\bmng
% 
\bnum
\num{1} upupx; lavaNa; aDugeya upupx; soVDiyaM kolxVreYDf. 
\num{2} (rAsAyanika) lavaNa; kASxradoDane Amalxvu oMdu loVha yA loVhadaMtha rAyxDikalalxnunx sathxLAMtarisuvudanunx oLagoMDaMte, rAsAyanika kirxyeyuMTu\-mADuvudariMda rUpugoLuLxva rAsAyanika saMyukatx. 
\num{3} kAra; curuku; ruci; sAvxrasayx: \eng{added salt to the conversation} mAtukatege sAvxrasayx seVrisida. \eng{talk full of salt} sAvxrasayxvAda, curukAda -- mAtu. 
\numi{4} (\Eva\ yA \bava dalilx) 
\banum
\alnum{a} lavaNa; upupx; ruci, racane, \mo vugaLalilx upapxnunx hoVluva padAthaR: \eng{bath salts.} 
\alnum{b} (\kanmu\ \bava dalilx) (BeVdi) upupx; vireVcaka lavaNa: \eng{take a dose of salt} oMdu DoVsu BeVdi upupx tegeduko. 
\hypertarget{salt(1)5}{} 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} upupx jwgu; cwLu jwgu; \kanmu\ hululxgAvalAgi yA upupx tayArisalu kaDala niVru biTuTxkoLaLxlu baLasuva parxdeVsha. 
\hypertarget{salt(1)6}{} 
\num{6} nurita nAvika; paLagida yA anuBavasathx kalAsi, nAvika. 
\num{7} (\bava dalilx) (nadiyoLakekx) kaDalaniVrina -- parxvAha, honalu, mahApUra; nadiyoLakekx samudarxda niVru vipariVtavAgi nugigx baruvudu. 
\num{8} upipxna Dabibx yA taTeTx; baDisikoLaLxlu upupx tuMbiTiTxruva siVse yA taTeTx. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{above the salt} (\ca) meVlupaMkitxyalilx; doDaDxvara paMkitxyalilx; UTadalilx maneyavara, utatxma dajeRyavara matutx sarisamAnara jote. 
\num{2} \eng{anyone worth his salt} dakaSxrAdavaru yA ahaRru yAreV Agali. 
\num{3} \eng{Attic salt} (BASe, sheYligaLa \vi) susaMsakxqqta; pariSakxqqta; pwrxDha. 
\num{4} \eng{bath salt(s)} sAnxnada upupx(gaLu); majajxna lavaNa(gaLu); sAnxnada niVrige sugaMdha niVDalu seVrisuva lavaNa(gaLu). 
\num{5} \eng{below the salt} (\ca) keLapaMkitxyalilx; UTadalilx keLadajeRyavara matutx ALukALugaLa jote. 
\num{6} \eng{drop} (\engit{or} \eng{put) salt on the tail of} (sere) hiDi (toVkeya meVle upupxdurisi hakikxyanunx sulaBavAgi hiDiyabahudeMdu makakxLige hAsayxvAgi heVLutitxdudxdariMda). 
\numi{7} \eng{eat one's salt} obabxna upupx tinunx: 
\banum
\alnum{a} atithiyAgiru. 
\alnum{b} AshirxtanAgiru; obabxnanunx asharxyisiru, avalaMbisiru. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{eat salt with} obabxna atithiyAgu. 
\num{9} \eng{Epsom salt(s)} BeVdi upupx; vireVcaka lavaNa(gaLu); BeVdi mADisuva lavaNa(gaLu). 
\numi{10} \eng{in salt} (keDadaMte iDalu) 
\banum
\alnum{a} upupx -- seVrisida, hAkida, udurisida. 
\alnum{b} upipxnalilx yA upupxniVrinalilx UriTaTx. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{11} \eng{is not worth his salt} 
\banum
\alnum{a} daMDapiMDa; avanige koDuva yA avanu tegedukoLuLxva saMbaLakekx anahaR. 
\alnum{b} aparxyoVjaka. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{12} \eng{like a dose of salts} (\ashi) bahaLa beVga. 
\num{13} \eng{not made of salt} maLege hedarada; maLeyalilx neneyalu aLukada, hedarikeyilalxda. 
\num{14} \eng{old salt} = \hyperlink{salt(1)6}{$^1$salt\((6)\)}. 
\num{15} \eng{rub salt into wound} (avamAna \mo vanunx) hecicxsu; tiVvarxgoLisu (huNiNxna yA gAyada meVle bare hAku eMbaMte). 
\num{16} \eng{salts of lemon} masiyupupx; shAyi lavaNa; shAyiya kalegaLanunx hoVgalADisuva oMdu AkasxleVTf lavaNa. 
\numi{17} \eng{take with a grain} (\engit{or} \eng{pinch) of salt} 
\banum
\alnum{a} utepxrXVkeSxyeMdu parigaNisu; atuyxkitxyeMdu BAvisu. 
\alnum{b} naMbadiru. 
\alnum{c} adhaR naMbau; pUtiR naMbadiru. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{18} \eng{the salt of the earth} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (parxpaMca utatxmavAgalu kAraNarAda, itararige mAdariyAgiruva) sArapArxyaru; sherxVSaThxru; utatxmaru. 
\alnum{b} (Adhunika laGu \parx) baliSaThxru; shirxVmaMtaru; haNavaMtaru; dhanADhayxru. 
\alnum{19}\eng{white salt} biLi upupx; kaMdu kalulxpapxnunx shudidhxgoLisi tayArisida aDige upupx. 
\hyperdef{S}{salt(1) pagu(20)}{}

\num{1} (halavomemx \eng{the} padada muMde \parx) adeV; Binanxvalalxda; beVreyAgirada; oMdeV: \eng{everyone was looking in the same direction} parxtiyobabxrU oMdeV yA adeV dikikxnalilx noVDutitxdadxru. \eng{the same car was used in another crime} adeV kAranunx inonxMdu aparAdhadalUlx baLasalAgitutx. \eng{saying the same thing over and over} matetx matetx adeV viSayavanunx heVLutAtx. 
\num{2} veYvidhayxvilalxda; vayxtAyxsavilalxda; badalAgada; badalAvaNeyilalxda; oMdeV riVtiya; adeV riVtiya; EkariVtiya; EkatAnavAda: \eng{the life is perhaps a little same} baduku pArxyashaH savxlapx oMdeV riVtiyadAgirutatxde. \eng{the same old story} vayxtAyxsavilalxda adeV rUDhiya haLeya kate. 
\num{3} (\sA\ \eng{this, these, that, those} -- ivugaLa muMde \parx) (vayxkitx, vasutx yA viSayada bagegx) adeV; ideV; pUvoRVkatx; hiMde heVLida; pUvaRsUcita; hiMde sUcisida yA ciMtisida: \eng{this same man was later my tutor} hiMde heVLida I manuSayxneV muMde nanage guruvAda. \eng{what is the use of this same patience?} ideV sahaneyiMda Enu parxyoVjana? \eng{these same politicians would now have us believe etc.} (tirasAkxrapUvaRkavAgi) ideV rAjakAraNigaLu nAvu naMbali (itAyxdi) eMdu apeVkiSxsutAtxre. 
\num{4} (\eng{the} padada muMde \parx) adeV; oMdeV Ada; Binanxvalalxda; tadavxtAtxda; tadUrxpa; Eka -- rUpavAda, parxkAravAda; vayxtAyxsavilalxda; badalAgada: \eng{the same causes produce the same effects} oMdeV rUpada, EkarUpavAda kAraNagaLu oMdeV rUpada, EkarUpavAda kAyaRgaLanunx utapxtitx mADutatxve. \eng{the same observations are true of the others also} aveV viVkaSxNegaLu itara viVkaSxNegaLa viSayadalilxyU nijavAgive. \eng{all planets move in the same direction} elalx garxhagaLU oMdeV dikikxnalilx calisutatxve. \eng{say the same thing twice over} oMdeV, adeV viSayavanunx eraDeraDu sAri heVLu. \eng{bigotry is the same in every age} parxti yugadalilxyU aMdhABimAnadalilx vayxtAyxsaviradu. 
\hypertarget{same(1)5}{} 
\num{5} EkakAladalilx; omemxgeV: \eng{do not speak at the same time} EkakAladalilx mAtanADabeVDi. 
\num{6} AdarU; adeV kAlakekx yA kAladalilx (hiMde heVLidadxkekx virudadhxveMdu toVruva, Adare nijavAda yA jAcnxpakadalilxTuTxkoLaLxbeVkAda viSayavanunx seVrisuvAga \parx): \eng{you have to be firm, but at the same time you must be sympathetic} niVnu daqDhanishacxya hoMdirabeVku, AdarU adeV kAlakekx sahAnuBUtiyiMdalU kUDirabeVku. 
\num{7} (\pArxparx) adeV Ada; beVreyalalxda; Binanxvalalxda: \eng{words of the same nature with those he had first heard} avanu modalu keVLida bageyaveV yA savxrUpadaveV Ada padagaLu. 
\num{8} (A, adu, avu eMbaudakekx otutxkoDuva payARya padavAgi) A, adeV, aveV; aSeTxV: \eng{at the same time that I am trying to stop it} adanunx nAnu nililxsalu yatinxsutitxdadx kAladalilxyeV. \eng{to the same place where I had found it} adu nanage sikikxdadx jAgakekxV. \eng{sailors received the same pay as soldiers} sipAyigaLa saMbaLavanenxV (yA saMbaLadaSeTxV) nAvikarU paDedaru. \eng{gave the same answer as before} hiMdina utatxravanenxV koTaTxnu.

\num{3} (sAlada) tiVruve; pUtiR saMdAya. 
\num{4} (Saratutx, kataRvayx, vAgAdxnagaLa) pUreYke; neraveVrike; pAlane. 
\num{5} pArxyashicxtatx. 
\num{6} parihAra; samAdhAna; parxtiPala; daMDavAgi yA naSaTxBatiRgAgi paDedadudx, tegedukoMDadudx: \eng{demanded satisfaction} parihArakAkxgi otAtxyisida. 
\num{7} (\deVva) kirxsatxna pArxyashicxtatx; manuSayxra pApagaLigAgi kirxsatxnu mADikoMDa pArxyashicxtatx: \eng{Christ is the satisfaction for our sins} namamx pApagaLige kirxsatxnu pArxyashicxtatx (kirxsatxna kaSaTxgaLanunx jagatitxna pApagaLige sariyAda parihAraveMdu deVvaru opipxdAdxne eMbathaRdalilx). 
\num{8} davxMdavxyudadhx; Atamxgwrava kApADikoLaLxlu tanage avamAna mADidavana meVle mADuva davxMdavx yudadhxda avakAsha: \eng{give satisfaction} (Atamxgwrava rakiSxsalu) davxMdavxyudadhx mADu. \eng{demand satisfaction} (Atamxgwrava rakiSxsalu) davxMdavxyudadhxkekx AhAvxnisu. 
\num{9} (saMshayada \vi) samAdhAna; saMdeVha nivaqtitx yA parihAra. 
\num{10} aMgiVkAra; sivxVkAra; opipxge; samamxti; (satayx \mo vanunx) taqpitxkaraveMdu, vishavxsaniVyaveMdu dheYyaRvAgi aMgiVkarisuvudu yA opupxvudu.

\noindent

\bentry
\word[say(1)]{say}
\pron{seV}
\gl{\kirx}
\expl{}
(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{said} \ucAcx\ seDf; vataRmAna \parxpu\\Eva\ \eng{says} \ucAcx\ sesfZ; (\pArxparx) \parxpu vataRmAna \Eva\\eng{saith} \ucAcx\ setf, divxtiVya puruSa vataRmAna \Eva\ \eng{sayst}yA \eng{sayest,} \BU\ \eng{saidst} yA (\viparx) \eng{saidest}). 

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (nidiRSaTx padagaLanunx sAmAnayxvAgi mAtanADuva dhavxniyalilx) heVLu; anunx; enunx; ADu; usiru; nuDi: `\eng{said Damn}!' `hALAgali!' eMdanu. \eng{said that he was satisfied} tanage taqpitxyAyitu eMdu heVLidanu. 
\alnum{b} heVLu; nuDi; padagaLalilxDu; shabadxgaLalilx -- nirUpisu, vayxkatxpaDisu; aBivayxkitxgoLisu: \eng{that was well said} adanunx cenAnxgi yA oLeLxya sheYliyalilx heVLide. \eng{cannot say what I feel} nanage Enu aninxside eMbaudanunx heVLalAre, aBivayxkitxgoLisalAre. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} BaviSayx nuDi; AgutatxdeyeMdu heVLu, tiLisu: \eng{says that there will be war} yudadhx AgutatxdeyeMdu (BaviSayx) heVLutAtxne. 
\num{3} heVLu; nuDi; tiLisu; ukatxvAgiru; nidiRSaTx padagaLalilxru; nidiRSaTx pATha hoMdiru: \eng{the Bible says that thou shalt not steal} niVnu kadiyakUDadu eMdu beYbalf heVLutatxde (beYbalinalilx heVLide). \eng{it says here that he was killed} avanu kolegiVDAdaneMdu ililx ukatxvAgide. \eng{the clock says ten to six} gaDiyAra \eng{6} gaMTege \eng{10} nimiSa ideyeMdu heVLutatxde, tiLisutitxde. 
\num{4} (\kaparx dalilx) (daqDhavAgi) heVLalAgiru; nirUpitavAgiru; vaNiRtavAgiru; kaMThoVkatxvAgi ukatxvAgiru: \eng{the tree is said to be six hundred years old} A mara \eng{600} vaSaRgaLaSuTx haLeyadeMdu heVLalAgide. 
\num{5} (\AmA) (vayxkitxge EnanAnxdarU) mADalu -- heVLu, tiLisu: \eng{he said to bring the car} kAranunx taralu avanu heVLida. 
\num{6} viSaya -- tiLisu, heVLu: \eng{spoke for an hour but didn't say much} oMdu gaMTe mAtanADida, Adare hecucx viSayaveVnanUnx tiLisalilalx. 
\num{7} (vAdadalilx) heVLu; vAdavAgi yA nepavAgi -- niVDu, muMdiDu, muMdoDuDx: \eng{there is much to be said on both sides} eraDu pakaSxgaLa paravAgiyU heVLuvudu bahaLavAgide. \eng{have you anything to say for yourself?} ninanx paravAgi heVLuvudu, muMdiDuvudu EnAdarU ideyeV? 
\numi{8} (aneVkaveVLe kamaRpada nirapeVkaSx parxyoVgadalilx) (obabxna yA oMdara viSayavAgi) 
\banum
\alnum{a} aBipArxya heVLu yA tiLisu. 
\alnum{b} niNaRya heVLu; nidhARra tiLisu: \eng{there is no saying} (\engit{or} \eng{it is hard to say ) who it was} avanu yAru yA yArAgidadx eMbaudanunx (KacitavAgi) heVLalAguvudilalx (yA heVLuvudu kaSaTx). \eng{do say which you will have} nimage yAvudu beVkenunxvudanunx (nidhARravAgi) tiLisi. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{9} udAharaNeyAgi tegeduko; daqSATxMtavAgi sivxVkarisu: \eng{any country, say Sweden, might do the same} yAvudeV deVsha, udA. sivxVDanf, adanenxV mADabahudu. 
\num{10} (nidiRSaTx saMKeyx \mo vanunx) sarisumAreMdu eNisu; hatitxra hatitxra samaveMdu BAvisu: \eng{a few of them, say a dozen} \engit{or} \eng{so} avaralilx kelavaru, sumAru hanenxraDu athavA aSuTx jana. 
\num{11} (pArxthaRne, sotxVtarx, \mo vanunx) heVLu; paThisu; vAcana mADu. 
\num{12} (pATha \mo vanunx) opipxsu; bAyipAThavAgi, kaMThapAThavAgi -- heVLu, punarucacxrisu: \eng{can't say his tables} koVSaTxkavanunx bAyipAThavAgi heVLalAra. 
\num{13} (kale \mo vugaLa \vi) (oLAthaRvanunx yA udedxVshavanunx) heVLu; sUcisu; tiLisu: \eng{what is the director saying in this film?} nideRVshaka I sinimAdalilx tiLisutitxruvudeVnu? 
\num{14} usiru; ucacxrisu. 
\num{15} heVLu; mAtukoDu; Baravase koDu; vacana niVDu; vAgAdxna mADu: \eng{you said you would come} niVnu barutitxVyeMdu heVLidedx, mAtu koTiTxdedx. 
\num{16} Uhisu; kalipxsu; iTuTxko; BAvisu: \eng{say} (\engit{or} \eng{let us say )} enonxVNa; hAgiTuTxkoLoLxVNa. \eng{shall we say?} nAvu hAge kalipxsikoLoLxVNaveV? \eng{well, say it were true, what then?} sari, adu nijaveMdeV iTuTxkoLoLxVNa, muMdeVnu? 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} heVLu; mAtADu. 
\num{2} (\kAparx, vidhayxthaRdalilx) usi(su)ru; tiLisu; heVLu: \eng{what is your name, say}! ninanx hesareVnu, heVLu! 
\num{3} = \hyperlink{say(1) pagu9}{?pagu?\((9)\)}. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{and so say all of us} nAvelalxrU adanenxV, aMteyeV, hAgeyeV heVLutetxVve, adeV aBipArxyapaDutetxVve; namemxlalxra aBipArxyavU adeV. 
\num{2} \eng{easier said than done} ADuvudu sulaBa, mADuvudu kaSaTx; mADuvudakikxMta heVLuvudu sulaBa. 
\num{3} \eng{go without saying} heVLabeVkAgilalx; sapxSaTxvAgiyeV ide; sahajavAgiyeV ide: \eng{it goes without saying that I will help you} ninage nAnu sahAya mADutetxVneMbaudanunx heVLabeVkAgilalx (eMdare sapxSaTxvAgiyeV ide). 
\num{4} \eng{how say you?} (\nAyxshA) (nAyxyadashiRgaLanunx keVLuvalilx) niVvu EnanunxtitxVri? nimamx aBipArxya yA tiVmARna Enu? 
\num{5} \eng{I} \hyperref{kandict_d.pdf}{D}{dare(2) nuga}{$^2$dare} \eng{say}. 
\num{6} \eng{I'm not saying} nAnu A parxshenxge utatxra koDuvudilalx, utatxra koDalu nirAkarisutetxVne. 
\num{7} \eng{I cannot} (\engit{or} \eng{could not) say} nAnu heVLalAre; nanage gotitxlalx. 
\num{8} \eng{I must say} (TiVke mADuvAga) nAnu heVLabeVku: \eng{I must say that is silly} adu athaRhiVna eMdu nAnu heVLabeVkAgide. 
\hypertarget{say(1) pagu9}{} 
\num{9} \eng{I say}! (\birx) el! are! (gamana seLeyuva, saMBASaNe AraMBisuva, AshacxyaR sUcisuva udAgxrada mAtu): \eng{I say , who was that?} are, avanu yAru? \eng{I say , what a beauty}! ayAyx, eSuTx suMdara! 
\num{10} \eng{it is said} (hAge, aMte) ADike yA vadaMti ide. 
\num{11} \eng{I'll say} (\AmA) hwdu -nija, diTa. 
\num{12} \eng{let us say} udAharaNeyAgi; daqSATxMtavAgi. 
\num{13} \eng{never say die} nirAshe paDabeVDa; Ashe tayxjisabeVDa. 
\num{14} \eng{not to say} matutx nijavAgi; jotege vAsatxvavAgi: \eng{his language was irreverent, not to say blasphemous} avana BASe agwravadAdxgitutx, jotege nijavAgi pASaMDavU Agitutx. 
\num{15} \eng{said he etc; said I} avanu modalAdAdxgi heVLida. nAnu heVLide. 
\num{16} \eng{say a few words} oMderaDu mAtu ADu; savxlapx EnAdarU heVLu; puTaTx BASaNa mADu. 
\numi{17} \eng{say a good word for} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (oMdara yA obabxna paravAgi) oMdu oLeLxya mAtu ADu; hogaLu; shiPArasu mADu. 
\alnum{b} (obabxnanunx) samathiRsu. 
\hypertarget{say(1) pagu18}{} 
\eanum
\numie
\num{18} \eng{say away} heVLabeVkAdudanunx heVLibiDu, odaribiDu. 
\num{19} \eng{say for oneself} (saMBASaNeya yA BASaNada aMshavAgi, dhATiyalilx) (EnanAnxdarU) heVLu; (yAvudanAnxdarU) ADu. 
\num{20} \eng{say much} (\engit{or} \eng{something) for} (oMdara yA obabxna \vi) bahaLa heVLu; oLeLxya, utatxma guNa tiLisu; hogaLu; shAlxGisu. 
\numi{21} \eng{say no} 
\banum
\alnum{a} ilalxvenunx; nirAkarisu. 
\alnum{b} ADalilalxvenunx. 
\alnum{c} Aguvudilalx enunx; opapxdiru. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{22} \eng{say no more} (yAvudAdarU viSayada bagegx) mAtu nililxsu; bAyi mucucx; mAtu sAkumADu. 
\num{23} \eng{say nothing to} (\rUpa) (obabxnige) EnanUnx mADadiru; (obabxna meVle) yAvudeV pariNAma yA parxBAva uMTumADadiru; (obabxnanunx) savxlapxvU taTaTxdiru. 
\num{24} \eng{say on} = \hyperlink{say(1) pagu18}{?pagu?\((18)\)}. 
\num{25} \eng{say one's piece} tAnu heVLabeVkAdadxnunx heVLu, ADabeVkAdadxnunx ADu. 
\num{26} \eng{say out} sapxSaTxvAgi, pUtiRyAgi, bAyibiTuTx -- heVLibiDu. 
\num{27} \eng{say over} nenapiniMda heVLu; kaMThasathxvAgi paThisu. 
\numi{28} \eng{say (person) nay} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (obabxna koVrikege) ilalxvenunx; nirAkarisu. 
\alnum{b} viroVdhisu; virudadhxvAgi nuDi. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{29} \eng{say so} hAge heVLu; aMte nuDi: \eng{you may well say so} niVnu dhArALavAgi hAge heVLabahudu; ninanx heVLike pUtiR nAyxyabadadhxvAgide, samathaRniVyavAgide. 
\num{30} \eng{say something} EnAdarU heVLu; savxlapx mAtanADu; puTaTx BASaNa mADu. 
\num{31} \eng{say something for} (oMdara yA obabxna paravAgi) EnAdarU oLeLxyadanunx heVLu; savxlapx hogaLu. 
\num{32} \eng{says you}! (\AmA) (apanaMbike sUcisuva udAgxra) shudadhx abadadhx! nAnu opupxvudilalx! nAnu samamxtise! 
\numi{33} \eng{say the word} oMdu mAtu heVLu: 
\banum
\alnum{a} apapxNe (\mo vanunx) koDu. 
\alnum{b} hUM enunx; opipxge sUcisu yA anumati niVDu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{34} \eng{say when} (\AmA) (AhAra, pAniVyagaLa \vi) yAvAga (sAkeniside yA sAku mADabeVku) eMdu heVLu. 
\numi{35} \eng{say yes} 
\banum
\alnum{a} hwdenunx; Agali enunx; Agutatxde enunx. 
\alnum{b} (parxsAtxpa, yoVjane, \mo vakekx) samamxtisu; opipxge koDu. 
\alnum{c} (heVLikeyanunx) opipxko; daqDhapaDisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{36} \eng{sooth to say} nijadalilx; vAsatxvavAgi; nija heVLabeVkeMdare. 
\hypertarget{say(1) pagu(37)}{} 
\num{37} \eng{so to say} hAge heVLuvudAdare yA heVLabahudAdare; AlaMkArikavAgi heVLu vudAdare (atishayoVkitx, rUpaka, hosa padaparxyoVga, asapxSaTxte, oraTu mAtu, \mo vugaLanunx kaSxmisalu baLasuva aupacArika mAtu). 
\num{38} \eng{strange to say} AshacxyaR veMdare: \eng{strange to say he won} AshacxyaRveMdare, avanu gedadx. 
\num{39} \eng{suffice to say} iSuTx heVLuvudu sAku (heVLabahudAdudu inUnx beVkAdaSiTxdadxrU sadayxkekx) heVLiruvaSuTx sAku. 
\numi{40} \eng{that is to say} 
\banum
\alnum{a} eMdare; beVre mAtugaLalilx heVLuvudAdare; susapxSaTxvAgi heVLuvudAdalilx : \eng{the whole family, that is to say , four persons} iDiV kuTuMba, eMdare, nAlukx jana. 
\alnum{b} athavA -- kaDege, konege, koneya pakaSx, kaniSaThx pakaSx: \eng{he never went, that is to say , it is not recorded that he did} avanu hoVgaleV ilalx, athavA koneya pakaSx, avanu hoVgidadxneMdAdarU dAKalAgilalx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{41} \eng{the less} (\engit{or} \eng{least) said the better} mAtu kaDame mADidaSUTx yA heVLuvudu kaDameyAdaSUTx oLeLxyadu; AdaSuTx mAtanunx kaDame mADuvudu sariyAda mAgaR. 
\num{42}\eng{the said} (\nAyxshA yA \hA) pUvoRVkatx ; hiMde heVLida : \eng{the said witness} pUvoRVkatx sAkiSx. 
\num{43} \eng{they say} jana heVLutAtxre; eMdu janavadaMti, gALimAtu ide. 
\num{44} \eng{to be said} \engit{or} \eng{sung} heVLalu yA hADalu. 
\num{45} \eng{to say nothing of} heVLadidadxrU; lakiSxsadidadxrU; gamanisadidadxrU; kaDegaNisidarU; upeVkiSxsidarU. 
\num{46} \eng{to say the least} atishayoVkitxyilalxde heVLuvudAdare. 
\num{47} \eng{what do} (\engit{or} \eng{would) you say to} niVvu EnanunxtitxVri?:\eng{what do you say to a cup of coffee?} oMdu kapupx -- kAPiZge EnanunxtitxVri? kAPiZ kuDiyoVNaveV? 
\num{48} \eng{what} (\engit{or} \eng{whatever) one says goes} (\AmA) avanu heVLidudx naDeyabeVku; A vayxkitxge adanunx heVLuva adhikAra ide matutx adanunx itararu pAlisabeVku. 
\num{49} \eng{when all is said and done} aMtimavAgi; konege; kaTaTxkaDege; elalx heVLi matutx mADi Ada meVle; heVLuvudelAlx mADuvudelAlx mugida taruvAya. 
\hypertarget{say(1) pagu50}{} 
\num{50} \eng{you can say that again}! (\AmA) niVnu adanunx (sariyAgi) heVLide; nAnu adanunx pUtiR opupxtetxVne; niVnu adanunx matotxmemx yA inonxMdu sala heVLabahudu. 
\num{51} \eng{you don't say (so)} (\AmA) (AshacxyaR yA apanaMbike sUcisuva mAtAgi) niVnu hAge heVLuvudilalx (yA heVLutitxlalx) tAne! adanunx naMbalAguvudilalx; adu vishAvxsAhaRvalalx. 
\num{52} \eng{you said it} = \hyperlink{say(1) pagu50}{?pagu?\((50)\)}. 
\enum

\bentry
\word{scene}
\pron{siVnf}
\gl{\nA}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (\pArxparx) raMgasathxla; raMgaBUmi; nATakaraMga. 
\num{2} kAyaRkeSxVtarx; kAyaRraMga. 
\num{3} (raMgasathxladalilx parxdashiRtavAguvaMte yAvudeV GaTaneyu parxdashiRtavAguva) raMga; jAga; kaLa; sathxLa: \eng{this world is the scene of strife} I loVka (bALu) oMdu hoVrATada kaLa; jiVvanavu oMdu saMgArxmaraMga. 
\num{4} (\AmA) kAyaRda yA Asakitxya keSxVtarx: \eng{not my scene} nananx kAyaRkeSxVtarxvalalx. 
\num{5} bALina -- riVti, vidhAna, parisara: \eng{the political scene} rAjakiVyada parisara. 
\num{6} raMga; GaTanasAthxna; yAvudeV GaTaneyu naDeyuva sathxLa: \eng{the scene is laid in India} kirxyAraMgavu iMDiya; GaTaneyu naDeyuva sathxLa BArata. \eng{the scene of the disaster was the North Sea} apaGAta naDeda sathxLa utatxrasamudarx Agitutx. 
\numi{7} (nATakada \vi) daqshayx: 
\banum
\alnum{a} (nATaka, calanacitarx, pusatxka, \mo vugaLalilx) oMdeV sathxLadalilx, \sA\ pAtarxgaLalilx badalAvaNe ilalxde, naDeyuva saMgatigaLa viBAga. 
\alnum{b} aMkada oMdu viBAga: \eng{Act II, scene 1} eraDaneya aMka, modalaneya daqshayx; divxtiVyAMka, parxthama daqshayx. \eng{the famous duel scene in Hamlet} hAyxmelxTf nATakadalilxna suparxsidadhx davxMdavx yudadhxda daqshayx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} (yAvudeV vayxkitxya jiVvanada oMdu parxmuKavoV sAvxrasayxkaravoV Ada) GaTaneya -- kathana, vaNaRne, daqshayx: \eng{scenes from clerical life} pAdirx jiVvanada kelavu daqshayxgaLu. 
\num{9} nijajiVvana, kathe, \mo vugaLalilxna yAvudeV GaTane, saMgati: \eng{distressing scenes occurred} viSAdakaravAda GaTanegaLu naDeduhoVduvu. 
\num{10} raMpa; gadadxla; avAMtara; (\kanmu\ itararige mujugaravAguvaMte) koVpa \mo vanunx parxdashiRsuva sAvaRjanika GaTane: \eng{made a scene in the restaurant} hoVTelinalilx oMdu avAMtara mADida. \eng{it was a shameless scene of mutual abuse} adoMdu parasapxra beYdATada mAnageTaTx gadadxlavAgitutx. 
\num{11} raMgadaqshayx; siVnu; raMgasathxlada meVle yAvudeV GaTaneya daqshayxvanunx parxdashiRsalu odagisuva, vaNaRcitarxNa mADida paradegaLu, halagegaLu, \mo vu. 
\num{12} raMgasajujx; raMga parxsAdhana; raMgaparxdashaRnakekx beVkAda salakaraNegaLa taMDa. 
\num{13} (sutatxlU haraDiruva) nisagaRda, parxkaqtiya daqshayx yA noVTa: \eng{a silvan scene} vanAMtara daqshayx. \eng{a desolate scene} pALunoVTa; goVLu kareyutitxruva vijanadaqshayx. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{behind the scenes} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (raMgashAle) paradeya, tereya hiMde; neVpathayxdalilx; paradeya hiMde naDeyuva calanavalana, paradeya hiMdiniMda keVLisuva sadudx, \mo vugaLa sUcane. 
\alnum{b} (\rUpa) (tereya) mareyalilx; EkAMtavAgi; goVpayxvAgi; rahasayxvAgi; guTATxgi; janara kaNiNxge biVLade, kivige keVLade: \eng{the two Prime Ministers carried on the delicate talks behind the scenes} ibabxru parxdhAnigaLU sUkaSxmXvAda I mAtukategaLanunx guTiTxnalilx naDesidaru. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{behind-the-scenes} (visheVSaNavAgi) teremareya; rahasayx; goVpayx; gUDha: \eng{a behind-the-scenes investigation} teremareya shoVdha. 
\hypertarget{scene pagu(3)}{} 
\num{3} \eng{change of scene} daqshayx badalAvaNe; beVsara, manoVvayxthe, \mo vugaLanunx kaLedukoLuLxva saluvAgi citAtxkaSaRkavAda noVTagaLu, vasutxgaLu, \mo vugaLiruva sathxLakekx yA sathxLagaLige mADuva parxvAsa. 
\num{4} \eng{come on the scene} baru; parxveVshisu; Agamisu. 
\numi{5} \eng{quit the scene} 
\banum
\alnum{a} kAyaRraMgadiMda nigaRmisu; kAyaRkeSxVtarxvanunx biTuTx horaDu. 
\alnum{b} jiVvanaraMgavanunx biTuTx horaDu; ihaloVka biDu, tayxjisu; sAyu. 
\hypertarget{scene pagu(6)}{} 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} \eng{set the scene} (kAdaMbari \mo vugaLa \vi) raMga sidadhxgoLisu; GaTanegaLu naDeyuva sathxLa, parisaragaLanunx kaNiNxge kaTuTxvaMte vaNiRsu.

\numi{11} paMtha; mAgaR; saMparxdAya; paraMpare; shAKe:

\bentry
\word{sea}
\pron{siV}
\gl{\nA}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} kaDalu; samudarx; muninxVru (\gArxM); jaladhi; sharadhi; aMbaudhi; sAgarada parxdhAna BAgagaLalolxMdu: \eng{by sea and land} samudarxda matutx BUmiya mUlaka; samudarx hAgU BU mAgaRvAgi. \eng{at the bottom of the sea} kaDalaDiyalilx; samudarxtaladalilx. 
\num{2} (BAgashaH yA pUtiRyAgi BUmiyiMda sututxvarediruva, nela yA sihiniVrige virudadhxvAgi) kaDala BAga; samudarx: \eng{the North sea} utatxra samudarx. \eng{the Caspian sea} kAyxsipxyanf samudarx. \eng{the Dead Sea} maqta samudarx; DeDf siV. 
\num{3} oLanADina (sihiniVrina) saroVvara: \eng{Sea of Galilee} geliliV saroVvara; geliliV parxdeVshada baLi iruva sihiniVrina saroVvara. 
\num{4} samudarxda sithxti; \kanmu\ alegaLa calane yA sithxtige saMbaMdhisidaMte samudarxda shAMta, parxkuSxbadhx, \mo\ yAvudeV parisithxti: \eng{seas mountains high} beTaTxdetatxrada samudarx; pavaRtoVpama samudarx; beTaTxdetatxrada alegaLiMda kUDida samudarx. 
\numi{5} (\rUpa) kaDalu; sAgara; samudorxVpama; kaDalinaMthadudx; apAravAdadudx; anaMtavAdadudx; atayxMta vishAlavAdadudx yA BAri motatxdudx: \eng{a sea of troubles} kaSaTxgaLa kaDalu; apAra kaSaTxgaLu. \eng{a sea of grief} duHKAMbaudhi; shoVkasAgara. . (visheVSaNavAgi yA \sapUpa vAgi) 
\banum
\alnum{a} kaDala -; kaDalina: \eng{sea lettuce} kaDala leTisf sopupx. 
\alnum{b} kaDalinalilx -- huTiTxda, vAsisuva, saMcarisuva, modalAdAdxgi. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{all at sea} = \hyperlink{sea pagu2b}{?pagu?(2b)}. 
\numi{2} \eng{at sea} 
\banum
\alnum{a} kaDalinalilx; samudarxdalilx; BUmiyiMdAce; (\kanmu) BUmige kANadaMte. 
\hypertarget{sea pagu2b}{} 
\alnum{b} digABx rxMtanAgi; dikukx toVcade; dikukxgeTuTx; neletapipx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} \eng{beyond sea(s)} = \hyperref{kandict_o.pdf}{O}{oversea(1)}{$^\bg 1\& 2\eg$oversea(s)}. 
\num{4} \eng{by sea} kaDala mAgaRvAgi; samudarxda mUlaka; haDaginalilx; haDagina mUlaka. 
\hypertarget{sea pagu5}{} 
\num{5} \eng{follow the sea} nAvikanAgu; nAvika vaqtitxyananxvalaMbisu. 
\num{6} \eng{go to sea} = \hyperlink{sea pagu5}{?pagu?\((5)\)}. 
\num{7} \eng{heavy sea} BAri BAri alegaLa samudarx; doDaDx doDaDx teregaLeVLuva kaDalu. 
\num{8} \eng{inland sea} oLanADina kaDalu; sutatxlU pUtiR BUmiyiMda AvarisalapxTaTx (yAvudeV) samudarx. 
\num{9} \eng{long sea} udadxneya alegaLa kaDalu; karxmavAgi ududxdadxneya teregaLeVLuva (sAmAnayx) samudarx; niDuderegaLa samudarx. 
\numi{10} \eng{on the sea} 
\banum
\alnum{a} haDaginalilx; kaDalinalilx; samudarxdalilx. 
\alnum{b} kaDala taDiyalilx; kaDala kareyalilx; karAvaLiyalilx; samudarxtiVradalilx: \eng{the town stands on the sea} A paTaTxNa kaDala kareyalilxde. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{11} \eng{put (out) to sea} reVviniMda horaDu; nela yA baMdaru biTuTx horaDu. 
\num{12} \eng{sea} \hyperref{kandict_a.pdf}{A}{anemone pagu(1)}{anemone}. 
\num{13} \eng{seas of blood} (\rUpa) netatxrina kaDalu; rakatxsAgara; kagogxle mADi harisida netatxrina koVDi; nidaRyavAda rakatxpAta. 
\num{14} \eng{ship a sea} (haDagu \mo vugaLa \vi) alegaLiMda tuMbihoVgu; alegaLa niVriniMda mucicx hoVgu. 
\num{15} \eng{short sea} kiruderegaLa kaDalu; tuMDalegaLa kaDalu; gALi biVsidaMte ubibx aDaguva caMcala alegaLiMda kUDida kaDalu. 
\hypertarget{sea pagu(16)}{} 
\num{16} \eng{the seven seas} sapatx samudarxgaLu, sAgaragaLu [AkfRTikf, aMTAkfRTikf, \kanu\ pesiPiZkf, \da\ pesiPiZkf, \kanu\ aTAlxMTikf, \da\ aTAlxMTikf matutx hiMdU(mahA)sAgaragaLu]. 
\num{17} \eng{to be (all) at sea} nelegANade; Enu mADabeVkeMdu toVrade; dikekxV toVcade; digABx rxMtanAgi: \eng{the problem is very tough; I am (all) at sea} I samaseyx tiVra kaThinavAdadudx; nanage dikekxV toVcadaMtAgide. 
\num{18} \eng{arm of the sea} (ALavAda) samudarxda shAKe, cAcu; KAri. 
\num{19} \eng{the high seas} naDugaDalu; sAvaRjanika samudarxBAga; yAvudeV deVshada adhikArakekx oLapaDada mukatx samudarxBAga. 
\num{20} \eng{when the sea gives up its dead} parxLayavAdAga; elalx jiVvarugaLa punarutAthxnavAdAga; aMtima mahAvicAraNeya dina. 
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\num{3} (sinimA, paMdayx, \mo vanunx) noVDu; viVkiSxsu. 
\num{4} (parxshenx yA shoVdhane yA AloVcaneya mUlaka) kaMDuhiDi; gotutxmADu; nidhaRrisu: \eng{could you go and see what the children are doing?} niVnu hoVgi makakxLu Enu mADutitxdAdxreMdu noVDutitxVyA? \eng{I will see what I can do to help} sahAya mADalu nAnu Enu mADabahudeMbaudanunx noVDutetxVne, nidhaRrisutetxVne. 
\num{5} yoVcisu; BAvisu; parigaNisu; Uhisu: \eng{I see that you are a brave man} niVnobabx dhe YyaRvaMta eMdu UhisutetxVne. 
\num{6} niriVkiSxsu; muMgANu; muMBAvisu: \eng{we saw that no good would come out of it} adariMda oLeLxyadu EnAdarU AgutatxdeyeMdu nAvu niriVkiSxsalilalx. \eng{his colleagues saw him as a future prime minister} avana sahoVdoyxVgigaLu avananunx obabx BAvi parxdhAnamaMtirxyanAnxgi muMgaMDaru. 
\num{7} (\sA\ vidhayxthaRdalilx, pusatxkavoMdanunx yA pusatxkadalilxna BAgavoMdanunx) mAhitigAgi -- noVDu, avaloVkisu: \eng{see page 15} hadineYdaneya puTa noVDu. 
\num{8} saMdhisu; BeVTiyAgu; BeVTi mADu; hatitxravidudx gurutisu: \eng{I saw your mother yesterday} nAnu nenenx nimamx tAyiyanunx kaMDe, noVDide, BeVTiyAde. 
\num{9} (pirxya saMgAtiyAgi) yAranAnxdarU niyatavAgi saMdashiRsu, BeVTi mADu, saMpakiRsu yA yAra joteyAdarU savxlapx kAlakaLe: \eng{she does not want to see him any more} inunx muMde avananunx noVDalu, avana jote seVralu avaLige iSaTxvilalx. \eng{he is still seeing that short girl} avanu inUnx A kuLiLxyanunx noVDutitxdAdxne, A kuLiLxyoDane saMpakaR iTuTxkoMDidAdxne. 
\num{10} BeVTi koDu; saMdashiRsu: \eng{the doctor will see you today} veYdayxru iMdu ninanxnunx BeVTi mADutAtxre. 
\num{11} salahegAgi -- hoVgu, BeVTi mADu, saMdashiRsu: \eng{went to see the doctor} veYdayxranunx noVDalu hoVda, salahe keVLalu hoVda. 
\num{12} (\kanmu\ daqshayxmUlavoMdariMda) ari; tiLi; noVDidadxriMda garxhisu: \eng{I see the show has been cancelled} parxdashaRna radAdxdudanunx (patirxke, parxkaTane, \mo vanunx noVDi, Odi) arite. 
\num{13} noVDu; kANu; aBipArxya taLe yA athaR kalipxsu: \eng{I see things differently now} viSayagaLu Iga nanage beVre riVti kANutitxve; Iga nAnu viSayagaLanunx beVre daqSiTxyiMda noVDutetxVne (avugaLa bagegx beVre aBipArxyagaLanunx taLeyutetxVne). \eng{try to see the matter from her point of view} viSayavanunx avaLa daqSiTxkoVnadiMda noVDalu, athaR mADikoLaLxlu parxyatinxsu. \eng{I see it as being quite possible} Iga adu saMpUNaRvAgi sAdhayxveMdu nanage kANutatxde (toVrutatxde). 
\num{14} (yAvudanenxV) BAvisiko; Uhisiko; kalipxsiko; manasisxnalilx citirxsiko: \eng{cannot see him agreeing to it} avanu adakekx opipxkoLuLxtAtxneMdu kalipxsikoLaLxlAre. 
\num{15} kANu; anuBavadiMda ari; anuBavisu: \eng{he has seen a great deal in his long life} sudiVGaR jiVvanadalilx avanu bahaLaSuTx kaMDidAdxne, anuBavisidAdxne. \eng{whoever can see death?} yAru tAne maqtuyxvanunx (parxtayxkaSx vAgi) kANabalalxru? \eng{I never saw such a mess} iMtha holasanunx, avayxvasethxyanunx nAnu eMdU kaMDilalx. 
\num{16} manasAre opupx; samamxtisu: \eng{do you see your daughter marrying this man?} ninanx magaLu I manuSayxnanunx maduveyAguvudanunx opupxtitxVyA? 
\num{17} (madhayxparxveVsha mADade) sumamxne noVDikoMDiru; sAkiSxyAgiru; noVDutAtx niMtiru; sahisikoMDiru: \eng{are you going to see me treated like this?} nanage hiVge mADutitxruvudanunx (taDeyade yA taDeyalu yatinxsade) sumamxne noVDutAtx niMtirutitxVyA? 
\num{18} (yAvudeV kelasa \mo vanunx) noVDiko; meVlivxcAraNe mADu; vayxvasethxgoLisu: \eng{see all the doors locked before you leave} niVnu hoVguva modalu elAlx bAgilugaLigU biVga hAkideyeV noVDu. \eng{see that it is done} A kelasa AguvaMte noVDiko, EpARDu mADu. \eng{see (that) you don't catch your foot} ninanx kAlu sikikxhAkikoLaLxdaMte ecacxra vahisu. 
\num{19} AkaSaRNe kANu: \eng{can't think what she sees in him} avanalilx Enu AkaSaRNe kANutAtxLoV tiLiyadu. 
\num{20} (oMdu sathxLa \mo vakekx gwravAthaRvAgi yA biTuTxbaralu vayxkitxgaLa) joteyalilx, saMgaDa, oDane, oMdige -- hoVgu: \eng{may I see you home?} nimomxDane maneyavaregU baraleV? nimamxnunx manege biTuTx baraleV? 
\num{21} (yAvudeV saMgati, GaTane, parisithxti, \mo vanunx) kANu; noVDu; perxVkaSxkanAgiru; sAkiSxyAgiru: \eng{saw the New Year in} hosa vaSaR udisidadxnunx, pArxraMBavAdudanunx kaMDe. \eng{has seen his income gradually decrease} tananx varamAna karxmeVNa kugugxtitxruvudanunx kaMDidAdxne. 
\num{22} (yAvudeV saMBavisuva, naDeyuva) kAla yA parxdeVsha yA parisithxti -- Agiru: \eng{this year sees the birth of a new movement} I vaSaR hosa caLavaLiyoMdara udayavanunx, huTaTxnunx kANutatxde. \eng{this stadium has seen many thrilling matches} I kirxVDAMgaNa aneVka roVmAMcaka paMdayxgaLanunx kaMDide; I kirxVDAMgaNadalilx aneVka roVmAMcakAri paMdayxgaLu jarugive. 
\numi{23} (jUjATadalilx, \kanmu\ poVkarf isipxVTATadalilx) savAlopupx; bAji -- samanAgisu, samamADu:

\alnum{b} (\kanmu\ eduru ATagArana elegaLanunx noVDalu avana) samanAda bAji kaTuTx.

\bentry

\pron{siVkf}
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{sought} \ucAcx\ sATf). }
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (vayxkitxyanunx, vasutx yA viSayavanunx) huDuku; arasu; kaMDu hiDiyalu yatinxsu; anevxVSisu: \eng{seek some place} yAvudeV sathxLavanunx huDuku. \eng{seek some person} yAvaneV vayxkitxyanunx huDuku, arasu. \eng{seek some information in a book etc.} pusatxka \mo vugaLalilx (beVkAda) yAvudeV viSayavanunx huDuku. 
\num{2} yAvudanenxV (obabxriMda) keVLu, koVru: \eng{I sought help from him} nAnu avaniMda neravanunx koVride. \eng{he seeks my aid} avanu nananx sahAyavanunx koVrutAtxne, keVLutAtxne. \eng{seek advice} baudidhxvAdavanunx, salaheyanunx -- keVLu. 
\num{3} (\pArxparx) (yAvudanenxV) paDeyalu parxyatinxsu. 
\num{4} (yAvudeV guriyanunx) sAdhisalu, gaLisalu -- parxyatanx mADu: \eng{seek a situation} kelasavanunx, nwkariyanunx, udoyxVga vanunx -- huDuku, paDeyalu parxyatinxsu. \eng{he seeks scope for his energies} avanu tananx shakitx sAmathaRyxgaLige (sariyAda) avakAshavanunx huDukutitxdAdxne yA paDeyalu bayasutitxdAdxne, parxyatinxsutitxdAdxne. \eng{many people seek wealth, but few find it} bahumaMdi aishavxyaR paDeyalu parxyatinxsutAtxre, Adare adanunx paDeyuvavaru tiVra viraLa. 
\num{5} Asharxya huDuku; Asharxyisu: \eng{the tired wayfarer sought shelter under the shade of a tree} AyAsagoMDidadx A dArihoVka oMdu marada neraLalilx Asharxya huDukida, oMdu marada neraLanunx Asharxyisida. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent

\bentry
\word{seem}
\pron{siVmf}
\gl{\kirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
(hAge, hAgiruvaMte) toVru, kANu: \eng{be what you seem} (\engit{or} \eng{seem to be)} toVruvaMte iru; niVnu EnAgiruvaMte kANutitxVyoV adeV Agiru; iruvudeV oMdu, toVruvudeV oMdu, AgabeVDa; soVgu hAkabeVDa; kapaTi AgirabeVDa; ASADhaBUtiyAgirabeVDa. \eng{he seemed to be the ringleader} avaneV guMpina muKaMDanAgi kaMDa. \eng{he seems to be tired} AyAsagoMDavanaMte toVrutAtxne. \eng{he seems to be a good fellow} avanu oLeLxya AsAmiyaMte kANutAtxne. \eng{he is not the angel he seems to be} (noVDuvudakekx) avanu heVge kANutAtxnoV aMtha deVvate, sherxVSaThx vayxkitx EnU alalx. \eng{I seem to see him still} avananunx nAnu (nananx kaNeNxdurinalilx) kANutitxruvaMte toVrutitxde. 
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{can't seem to do (something)} (\AmA) (yAvudanenxV) mADalAre yA mADalAra (\mo) eMdu, toVru: \eng{somehow I can't seem to write anything to-day} ivatutx EkoV EnanUnx bareyaleV Are eMdu toVrutitxde; ivatutx EkoV EnanUnx bareyalu AgadaMtide. 
\num{2} \eng{do not seem to} (\AmA) EkoV Agutitxlalx : \eng{I do not seem to like him} avananunx kaMDare nanageVkoV Agutitxlalx. 
\num{3}\eng{it seems that . . .} aMte: \eng{it seems that you were lying} niVnu suLuLx heVLutitxdadxMte toVrutatxde. 
\num{4} \eng{it seems to me that etc. . . .} eMdu nanage toVrutatxde: \eng{it seems to me that it will rain today} ivatutx maLe baruvudeMdu nanage toVrutatxde. \eng{it seems to me that such talk is absurd} iMtaha mAtu asaMbadadhxveMdu nanage toVrutitxde. 
\num{5} \eng{it would} (\engit{or} \pArxparx\ \eng{should) seem etc.} (apirxyavAda aBipArxya \mo vanunx koDuvAga, jAgarUka sheYliyalilx mAtanADuva riVti) -- eMdu toVrutatxde. \eng{it would seem that the contemplated scheme is not practicable} Iga yoVcisutitxruva yoVjaneyu vayxvahAyaRvalalxveMdu toVrutatxde; Iga yoVcisutitxruva yoVjaneyanunx kAyaRrUpakekx taralAguvudilalxvenisutatxde. 
\num{6} \eng{seem good to} sariyAgiruvudAgi kANu; oLeLxyadu eMdu toVru: \eng{this course seems good to me} I vidhAnavu oLeLxya dAri eMdu nanage toVrutatxde. 
\num{7} \eng{so . . .} (\engit{or} \eng{it seems)} AdadxriMda . . . . aMte: \eng{so we are to get nothing, it seems} AdadxriMda namage EneVnU siguvudilalx vaMte, namage EneVnanUnx koDuvudilalxvaMte. 
\num{8} \eng{what seemeth him good} (\pArxparx) yAvudanunx avanu oLeLxyadeMdu BAvisu tAtxnoV (adu). 
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\bentry

\bnum
\num{1} (\nAyxshA) (mAnayxvanunx yA hiDuvaLiyanunx) obabxna supaduR mADu; sAvxdhiVnapaDisu; vashapaDisu. 
\num{2} (kaLaLxsAgaNe, mArATa, \mo vugaLa sarakugaLu, saMshayAsapxda kAgadapatarxgaLu, leVKanagaLu, \mo vanunx kAnUnina baladiMda) vashapaDisiko; muTuTxgoVlu hAkiko; jPiZtx mADiko; hiDidiTuTxko. 
\numi{3} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (vayxkitx, pArxNi, vasutx, \mo vanunx) balAtAkxravAgi hiDiduko: \eng{seize person by the neck} vayxkitxyanunx kutitxge hiDidu nililxsu. \eng{seize person's hand} vayxkitxya keYyanunx balavAgi hiDiduko. 
\alnum{b} (shaturxgaLa koVTe, BUBAga, \mo vanunx idadxkikxdadxMte meVle bidudx) vashapaDisiko; Akarxmisiko: \eng{seize fortress} dugaRvanunx vashapaDisiko. 
\alnum{c} (vasutx \mo vanunx, obabxniMda) kasiduko; kitutxko: \eng{seize power} adhikAravanunx (balAtAkxravAgi) vashapaDisiko. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{4} (avakAsha, saMdaBaR, salahe yA BAvane, parasapxra tAratamayx, mamaR, \mo vanunx) kUDaleV hiDi, garxhisu; tapapxde arituko, baLasiko: \eng{seize an opportunity} \engit{or} \eng{occasion} avakAshavanunx yA saMdaBaRvanunx hiDiduko, biDade baLasiko. \eng{seize idea, point, essence (of a matter), etc.} yAvudeV viSayada BAvane, mamaR yA tiruLu, \mo vanunx kUDaleV garxhisu, hiDi, arituko. \eng{seize the distinction (between the two)} averaDara tAratamayxvanunx takaSxNaveV garxhisu. 
\num{5} (roVga, duHKa, pashAcxtAtxpa, \mo vugaLiMda) hiDiyalapxDu; garxsatxnAgu: \eng{he was seized with paralysis} avanu pAshavxRvAyugarxsatxnAda. \eng{he was seized with remorse} avanu pashAcxtAtxpakekx vashanAda. 
\num{6} (\nw) (huri, taMti, \mo vanunx, halavu sututx sutitx, haDagina yAvudeV eraDu BAgagaLanunx) bigi; bigidu kaTuTx. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} tavakadiMda (yAvudanenxV) hiDiduko, garxhisu: \eng{he seized upon that pretext} tavakadiMda avanu A nevavanenxV hiDidukoMDa. 
\num{2} (yAvudeV yaMtarxda oMdu calisuva BAgada \vi) kacicxkoMDu biDu; kacicxkoMDu bigiyAgu; naDeyade niMtu hoVgu.

\bnum
\num{1} iMdirxya shakitx; karaNa sAmathaRyx; (kaNuNx, kivi, \mo\ paMceVMdirxya gaLu) hoMdiruva, ariyuva yA saMveVdaneya -- shakitx: \eng{dull sense of smell} maMdavAda GArxNashakitx. 
\num{2} jAcnxneVMdirxya; karaNa ariyuva shakitxyuLaLx deVhada iMdirxya: \eng{the five senses} (bAhayx parxpaMcavanunx aritukoLaLxlu sAdhanagaLAda) dashaRna, sharxvaNa, GArxNa, rasanA matutx sapxshaR eMba paMca saMveVdanegaLu. 
\num{3} (\bava dalilx) (vayxkitxya) baudidhx; parxjecnx; jAcnxna; viveVka. 
\num{4} (vasutxgaLa asitxtavx, guNagaLanunx noVDuva, ariyuva, sapxshiRsi tiLiyuva) iMdirxyagaLa -- sUkaSxmXte, pATava, paTutavx. 
\num{5} (yAvudaradeV) arivu; parxjecnx; jAcnxna: \eng{the senses of pain} noVvina arivu. \eng{the sense of shame} avamAnada parxjecnx. \eng{the sense of responsibility} hoNegArikeya arivu; javAbAdxriya parxjecnx. 
\num{6} arivu; parxjecnx; vasutxvanunx, viSayavanunx, parisithxtiyanunx kUDaleV aritukoLuLxva tiVkaSx Nx shakitx yA parisithxtiyananxritu takakxMte naDedukoLuLxva sahaja shakitx: \eng{a sense of locality} saninxveVshada arivu. \eng{sense of the ridiculous} hAsayxgarxhaNa; hAsAyxsapxdavAdadadxnunx hAgeMdu kUDaleV garxhisuva shakitx. \eng{a sense of humour} hAsayxparxjecnx. \eng{a sense of duty} kataRvayxparxjecnx. \eng{a sense of gratitude} kaqtajacnxtA BAva(ne). \eng{a keen sense of honour} tiVvarxvAda gwravaparxjecnx, mayARdAparxjecnx; tananx gwravakekx kaLaMka tarabAradeMba utakxTavAda haMbala. 
\num{7} vayxvahArajAcnxna; parijAcnxna; aucitayxparxjecnx; yukAtxyakatx viveVka; viveVcana (shakitx); baudidhx: \eng{he has sound} (\engit{or} \eng{good) sense} avanige oLeLxya (pari)jAcnxna, viveVka, ide. \eng{he had not the sense to do it} adanunx mADuvaSuTx jAcnxna, viveVka, avanige iralilalx. \eng{what is the sense of talking like that?} hAge mAtanADuvudara aucitayx Enu? \eng{I have more sense than to do such a stupid thing} aMtha muTAThxLa kelasa mADuvudakikxMta hecucx baudidhx, viveVcane nanage ide. \eng{now you are talking sense} Iga niVnu mAtanADutitxruvudu viveVka. 
\num{8} padada, padagaLa -- athaR; mAtina -- udedxVsha, Ashaya, tAtapxyaR, mamaR, iMgita: \eng{the sense of the word is clear} I padada athaR sapxSaTxvAgiyeV ide. \eng{the strict sense of the word} I padada niSakxqqSaTxvAda athaR. \eng{literal sense} akaSxrashaH athaR; vAcAyxthaR. \eng{figurative, metaphorical sense} rUpakAthaR, AlaMkArika athaR. \eng{legal sense} nAyxyashAsatxrXda riVtAyx athaR. \eng{full sense} pUNARthaR. \eng{in a vague sense} anidiRSaTx, asapxSaTx athaRdalilx; sUthxla athaRdalilx. \eng{in every sense} samasatx athaRdalUlx. 
\num{9} sAmAnayx aBipArxya; sAmAnAyxBimata; halavu maMdiya oTuTx aBipArxya: \eng{take the sense of the meeting} saBeya (sAmAnayx) aBipArxyavanunx, aBimatavanunx tegeduko. 
\num{10} athaRvaMtike; athaRvAguvaMtiruvike; athaR hoMdiruvike; susaMbadadhxvAgiruvike. 
\numi{11} (\ga\ \mo vu) dishe: 
\banum

\alnum{b} dhanaveV \eng{(positive)} athavA QuNaveV \eng{(negative)} eMba mAhiti. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{be frightened out of one's senses} gAbariyiMda baudidhx sAvxdhiVna tapipxhoVgu: \eng{at the very sight of the cobra, he was frightened out of his senses} A nAgarahAvanunx noVDidaSaTxkekxV gAbariyiMda avanige baudidhx sAvxdhiVna tapipxhoVyitu. 
\num{2} \eng{be in one's senses} parxjecnx sariyAgiru; baudidhx sAvxdhiVnadalilxru, neTaTxgiru: \eng{are you in your senses?} ninage baudidhx sariyAgideyoV ilalxvoV? 
\num{3} \eng{be out of one's senses} baudidhx -- keTiTxru, neTaTxgilalxdiru; viveVkashUnayxvAgiru: \eng{he is out of his senses} avanige baudidhx keTiTxde; avanige viveVka hoVgibiTiTxde. 
\numi{4} \eng{bring a person to his} (\engit{or} \eng{her) senses} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (mUCiRta vayxkitxyanunx) ecacxrakekx taru; parxjecnx barisu. 
\alnum{b} (\rUpa) (aviveVkige) baudidhx barisu; viveVka taru: \eng{by his touching advice he brought his errant son to his senses} tananx manamuTuTxva baudidhxvAdadiMda Ata tapupx dAri hiDididadx tananx maganige baudidhx barisida. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{5} \eng{come to one's senses} 
\banum

\eanum
\numie
\num{6} \eng{errors of sense} iMdirxyajanayx doVSagaLu; iMdirxyagaLa (doVSadiMda uMTAda) tapapxrivugaLu. 
\num{7} \eng{in a} (\engit{or} \eng{one) sense} oMdu athaRdalilx, oMdu daqSiTxyiMda (noVDidare); yAvudeV viSayavanunx, heVLikeyanunx, oMdu siVmita daqSiTxyiMda parishiVlisidare, parigaNisidare: \eng{what you say is true in a sense} niVnu heVLutitxruvudu oMdu daqSiTxyiMda, oMdathaRdalilx nija. 
\num{8} \eng{make sense} athaRkoDu; athaR hoMdiru; athaRvAgu: \eng{does it make any sense ?} adakekxVnAdarU athaR videye? \eng{it makes no sense at all} adakekx EneVnU athaRvilalx. 
\num{9} \eng{make sense of} athaR kalipxsu; I athaR eMdu heVLu, vivarisu: \eng{at last I made some sense of that cryptic statement} kaTaTxkaDege nAnu A gUDhavAda heVLikege yAvudoV oMdu athaR kalipxsikoMDe.

\num{11} \eng{sense of direction} dikf parxjecnx; dikakxrivu; yArU mAgaRdashaRna mADadidadxrU tAnu yAva dikikxnalilx hoVgabeVkeMdu yA hoVgutitxdedxVneMdu ariyuva shakitx. 
\num{12} \eng{sense of} \hyperref{kandict_h.pdf}{H}{humour(1) pagu(5)}{$^1$humour}. 
\num{13} \eng{take leave of one's senses} hucucx hiDi; baudidhx keDu; baudidhx kaLedukoMDiru; parxjecnx hALAgiru: \eng{have you taken leave of your senses?} ninanx parxjecnx hALAgi hoVgideyeV? ninanx viveVkaveV hoVgibiTiTxdeye?

\num{16} \eng{the pleasures of sense} (iMdirxyacApalayxvanunx taqpitxpaDisuva) viSayasuKagaLu; iMdirxyaBoVgagaLu.

\numie

\bentry

\num{3} (yAvudeV) vayxkitxge, saMsethxge, seYnayxkekx, deVshakekx (\kanmu\ videVshagaLalilx) -- seVve salilxsu. 
\num{4} (vayxkitxya, pArxNiya yA kAyaRkekx beVkAda) agatayxgaLanunx pUreYsu: \eng{two buses serve the area} eraDu basusxgaLu A parxdeVshada agatayxgaLanunx pUreYsutatxve. 
\num{5} yAvudeV udedxVshakekx yA kAyaRkekx -- baru, odagu, neravAgu, upayoVgavAgu, parxyoVjanakekx baru, sAdhakavAgu: \eng{it serves the purpose} adu (niriVkiSxsida) udedxVshavanunx pUreYsutatxde, nivaRhisutatxde. \eng{to serve some private ends} yAvudeV sAvxthaRvanunx sAdhisikoDu; yAvudeV sAvxthaRkekx sAdhakavAgu. \eng{that excuse will not serve you} A nevadiMda ninageVnU upayoVgavAguvudilalx. \eng{nothing will serve him but absolute submission} saMpUNaR sharaNAgatiya horatu beVrAvudariMdalU avanige parxyoVjanavilalx. \eng{a sofa serving him as} (\engit{or} \eng{for) a bed too} avanige hAsigeyAgiyU upayoVgakekx baruva (yA hAsigeya kelasakUkx odaguva) oMdu soVphA. 
\numi{6} avadhi pUreYsu: 
\banum

\alnum{b} (kelasa kaliyuva kasabaudArana \vi) karArinalilx nigadipaDisida avadhipUtiR kelasa mADu. 
\alnum{c} (daMDanege guriyAdavana \vi) daMDaneya yA shikeSxya avadhipUtiR seremaneyalilx vidhisida kelasa (\mo vanunx) mADu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{7} (seYnayx) (PiraMgi sAlu, PiraMgi, \mo vanunx) hArisutatxleV iru. 
\num{8} (\nw) (hagagxgaLu \mo vanunx) saNaNx huriyiMda kaTiTx bigi. 
\numi{9} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (UTada meVjada meVle) UTa baDisu. 
\alnum{b} (aDige padAthaRgaLanunx) UTada meVjada meVle -- iDu, irisu, sidadhxgoLisu: \eng{fish, which was almost cold was served up} hecucxkaDime taNaNxgAgi hoVgidadx miVnanunx baDisalAyitu. \eng{toasted slices of bread were served with butter} hurida berxDiDxna bilelxgaLanunx beNeNxyoDane baDisidaru. \eng{serve up dinner} BoVjanakekx (aDige padAthaRgaLanunx meVjina meVle) sidadhxpaDisu. \eng{ladies and gentlemen, dinner is served} mahiLeyareV, mahaniVyareV BoVjana sidadhxvAgide, (meVjina meVle) sidadhxgoLiside. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{10} (yAvudanenxV) haMcu; vitarisu; vitaraNa mADu: \eng{serve ammunition} siDimadadxnunx vitaraNa mADu. \eng{serve out} (\engit{or} \eng{round) rations} (seYnikaru \mo varige) paDitaravanunx haMcu. 
\num{11} (vayxkitxge, girAkige, vasutxgaLanunx) sarabarAju mADu; odagisikoDu: \eng{the firm served its customers with various goods} A vANijayxsaMsethx tananx girAkigaLige bagebageya sarakugaLanunx sarabarAju mADutitxtutx. \eng{the Municipal Council serves the whole town with water and gas} muyxnisipalf saBeyu Urigelalx niVranUnx, (aDigeya) anilavanUnx odagisutatxde. 
\num{12} koVTiRna Ajecnxyanunx vidhivatAtxgi jAri mADu: \eng{served a warrant on him} avana meVle (yA avanige) vAreMTu jAri mADida. \eng{served him with a summons} avanige samanfsx jAri mADida. 
\numi{13} (Tenisf, bAYxDfmiMTanf) savfR mADu: 
\banum
\alnum{a} ATada AraMBada ceMDanunx hoDe; modala ceMDanunx hoDedu ATa AraMBisu. 
\alnum{b} hiVge savfRmADi (tapupx \mo vanunx) mADu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{14} (vayxkitxyoMdige) nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx -- vayxvaharisu, naDeduko, vatiRsu; (vayxkitxyanunx) nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx -- kANu: \eng{served me shamefully} avamAnakaravAgi nanonxMdige vatiRsida, nananxnunx kaMDa. 
\num{15} (deVvate \mo vakekx) seVve salilxsu; keYMkayaR mADu. 
\num{16} (pArxNiya, \kanmu\ taLi beLasuvudakAkxgi karesida gaMDu kudure \mo vugaLa \vi, saMtAnoVtapxtitxgAgi) heNuNx pArxNiyanunx saMBoVgisu.

\noindent

\bmng

\num{5} (samudarxda ubabxrada \vi) baMdaru \mo vugaLiMda horaDalu anukUlavAgiru: \eng{the tide serves} baMdaru biDalu ubabxra(Barata) anukUlavAgide.

\noindent

\banum

\bnum
\num{1} (hecucxkaDame sithxravAda nivAsa, sathxLa yA jiVvanakarxmadalilx) nelegoLisu; nele nililxsu; sAthxpisu: \eng{settled his son as an industrialist} tananx magananunx keYgArikoVdayxmiyanAnxgi nelegoLisida, sAthxpisida. 
\num{2} alAlxDadaMte, BadarxvAgi -- iDu, irisu, maDagu, Uru: \eng{settled his feet in the stirrups} rikApugaLalilx tananx kAlugaLanunx irisida, Urida.

\num{4} vayxvasithxtavAda yA sithxravAda jiVvana sheYli -- hiDi, anusarisu. 
\num{5} (kelasa, kAyARcaraNe, jiVvanavaqtitx, \mo vugaLalilx) toDagisiko: \eng{settled down to writing letters} kAgada bareyalu tananxnunx toDagisikoMDa. 
\num{6} (savxlapx hotutx) kUrisu; kUruvaMte mADu: \eng{settle oneself in the chair} kuciRyalilx ArAmavAgi kuLituko. \eng{settle the invalid in the pillows} (kAyileyiMda) nishashxkatxnAgiruvananunx diMbaugaLa naDuve kUrisu. 
\num{7} (savxlapx kAla) taMguvaMte, iLidukoLuLxvaMte, iruvaMte -- mADu. 
\num{8} sitxmitakekx, shAMtasithxtige -- taru; tiLiyAgisu: \eng{settle beer by leaving it to stand} biyaranunx hAgeyeV nilulxvudakekx biTuTx tiLiyAgisu. \eng{settle coffee with egg-white} moTeTxya biLupanunx hAki kAPiZyanunx tiLiyAgisu. 
\num{9} tiMda UTavanunx -- karagisu, jiVNaRgoLisu, pacanagoLisu. 
\num{10} (hadageTaTx hoTeTx, naragaLa vayxvasethx, \mo vanunx) tahabaMdige taru; hatoVTige taru; karxmagoLisu; susithxtige taru. 
\num{11} (manasasxnunx) nishicxta sithxtige, shAMtasithxtige, niSakxSaRkekx, sapxSaTx aBipArxya \mo vakekx athavA yAvudeV niNaRyakekx taru, baruvaMte mADu. 
\num{12} gotutx mADu; gotutxpaDisu; nishacxyisu; nidhaRrisu; niNaRyisu; tiVmARnisu; omamxtakekx, EkABipArxyakekx baru: \eng{settle the date} tAriVKanunx, dinavanunx nidhaRrisu. 
\numi{13} (jagaLa, vAyxjayx, parxshenx, viSaya, saMdeVha, \mo vanunx) 
\banum
\alnum{a} pariharisu; bageharisu. 
\alnum{b} AKeYrAgi tiVmARnisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{14} (parasapxra samamxtiyiMda mokadadxme \mo vanunx hiMtegedukoMDu) kAnUnu karxmavanunx -- mugisu, mukAtxyagoLisu, aMtayxgoLisu. 
\numi{15} 
\banum

\alnum{b} vasAhatudAraranunx nelegoLisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{16} (yAvudeV viSayavanunx) pUreYsibiDu; mugisu; samApitx mADu. 
\num{17} (vayxkitxyobabxna aDiDxyanunx, kATavanunx) kaLedukoMDubiDu. 
\num{18} (vAda, hoVrATagaLiMdaloV yA koMduhAkiyoV) pariharisiko; bageharisiko; pheYsalf mADu. 
\num{19} (lekAkxcAra, sAla, bilulx, \mo vanunx) pAvati mADu; tiVrisibiDu; cukAtx mADu (\akirx\ saha). 
\num{20} (AsitxpAsitx, vaSARshana, \mo vanunx, kAnUnubadadhxvAgi) obabx vayxkitxge (jiVvAvadhi anuBoVgakAkxgi) baredukoDu: \eng{he settled all his property on his wife} avanu tananx Asitxyanenxlalx tananx heMDatige (anuBoVgisalu) baredukoTaTx. \eng{he settled an annuity on his disabled son} tananx aMgavikalanAda maganige avanu oMdu vaSARshanavanunx baredukoTaTx. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (savxlapx hecucxkaDame kAyaM Agi nivAsa sathxLa \mo vugaLalilx) nelasu; nele nilulx: \eng{I shall settle in Mysore} nAnu meYsUrinalilx nelesutetxVne. 
\num{2} (savxlapx hotutx) kUru; kuLituko: \eng{settle down to dinner} BoVjanakekx kuLituko. \eng{settle down to a game of chess} oMdu ATa caduraMga ADuvudakAkxgi kuLituko. \eng{settle down to read} Odalu kuLituko. 
\num{3} (pakiSx) iLi; taMgu: \eng{the birds settle on the trees} hakikxgaLu maragaLa meVle taMgutatxve. 
\num{4} (maMju, katatxlu, \mo vugaLa \vi) (iLidu) musuku; Avarisu; kavi: \eng{the clouds have settled on the mountain} moVDagaLu beTaTxvanunx kavidive. 
\num{5} (roVgada \vi) (deVhadalilx yA yAvudeV aMgadalilx) beVrUru; beVru biDu; kAyamf Agi (niMtu) biDu. 
\num{6} sitxmitakekx baru; sithxravAgu; shAMtasithxtige baru; tiLiyAgu: \eng{things will settle into shape} parisithxti tiLigoMDu sariyAda rUpakekx barutatxde. \eng{marry and settle down} maduve yAgi sitxmitavAgi nele nilulx. \eng{settle down to married life} sithxravAgi dAMpatayx (jiVvana) naDesu. \eng{settle down to defensive play} (udevxVgAveVshagaLu aDagi) rakaSxNAthaRvAgi ADuva sithxtige baMdu nilulx. \eng{let the excitement settle down} A uderxVkavelalx aDagi shAMtasithxtige barali. 
\num{7} (manasusx nishicxta yA shAMtasithxtige yA niSakxSeRge) baru. 
\num{8} (oMdu deVsha, parxdeVsha, \mo vugaLalilx) nelesu; vasati hUDu; nelasu nADiganAgi yA vasAhatudAranAgi nilulx. 
\numi{9} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (jiDuDx, kiTaTx, \mo vugaLa \vi, darxvada) meVle nilulx; teVlu. 
\alnum{b} (kesaru, gaSuTx, \mo vugaLa \vi, darxvada) taLakekx iLi; taLadalilx nilulx: \eng{dust soon settles} dhULu beVga iLidu nelada meVle nilulxtatxde. \eng{the sediment settles at the bottom} rADiyu taLadalilx nilulxtatxde.

\num{10} (nela, mane, asitxBAra, \mo vugaLa \vi, karxmeVNa keLamaTaTxkikxLidu) BadarxvAgi, daqDhavAgi, sithxravAgi -- nilulx; taLavUru. 
\num{11} (haDagina \vi, karxmeVNa niVralilxLidu) taLamuTuTx; muLugi hoVgu.

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{settle down} 
\banum
\alnum{a} sithxravAgi -- nilulx, nelasu. 
\alnum{b} sAthxpisu; sithxravAgi nelegoLisu. 
\alnum{c} sithxravAgu yA sithxravAgisu. 
\alnum{d} sitxmitavAgu yA sitxmitagoLisu. 
\alnum{e} tiLiyAgu yA tiLiyAgisu. . taLakikxLi yA taLakikxLisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{2} \eng{settle one's affairs} 
\banum
\alnum{a} tananx sithxtigatigaLanunx vayxvasethxgoLisu, karxmakekx taru. 
\alnum{b} (\kanmu\ sAvu saninxhitavAdAga) uyilu mADu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} \eng{settle person's} \hyperref{kandict_h.pdf}{H}{hash(2) nuga(2)}{$^2$hash}. 
\num{4} \eng{settle the day} dina gotutxmADu; tAriVku nidhaRrisu. 
\num{5} \eng{settle the matter} (\engit{or} \eng{it)} viSayavanunx pheYsalu mADu; (matetx caciRsalu EnanUnx biDade, niviRvAdavAgi, nisasxMdigadhxvAgi) viSaya vanunx bageharisu; niSakxqqSaTxvAgi niNaRyisu: \eng{that settles it} (\engit{or} \eng{the matter)} idariMdAgi viSaya bageharidaMtAyitu, pheYsalAyitu. 
\num{6} \eng{settle to work} (\engit{or} \eng{to anything)} (yAvudeV kelasa mADalu, yAvudeV sithxtiyalilxralu) sitxmitavAgiru; sithxravAgi nilulx: \eng{a restless fellow cannot settle to anything} caMcala parxkaqtiyavanu yAvudaralUlx sitxmitavAgi nilalxlAra. 
\numi{7} \eng{settle up} 
\banum

\alnum{b} (yAvudeV viSayavanunx) phe Ysalf mADu; itayxthaR mADu; AKeYrAgi tiVmARnisu.

\bmng
(sahAyaka matutx parxdhAna \kirx) [
\banum
\alnum{a} utatxmapuruSa, \Eva\ \bava, BaviSayxtfkAla, vataRmAnagaLa rUpa: \eng{shall; I, we, shall,} yA \eng{'ll;} niSeVdhAthaRkavAgi \eng{I, we, shall not} yA \AmA\ \saMkiSx\ -- \eng{I, we, shan't} (\ucAcx\ SAnfTx). 
\alnum{b} madhayxmapuruSa, \pArxparx\ \Eva\ \eng{thou shalt}. 
\alnum{c} BUta \rUpa, utatxmapuruSa, \Eva, \bava\ \eng{shall I, we, should} \ucAcx\ Su(Sa)Df, niSeVdhAthaRkavAgi \eng{I, we, shouldn't} (\ucAcx\ SuDfnfTx). 
\alnum{d} madhayxmapuruSa, \Eva, \pArxparx\ \eng{thou shouldst} (\ucAcx\ SuDfsx Tx) yA \eng{thou shouldest} (\ucAcx\ SuDisfTx) niSeVdhAthaRkavAgi \eng{should not}, (\AmA) \eng{shouldn't} (\ucAcx\ SuDfnfTx).] 
\bnum
\numi{1} (sahAyaka \kirx ) (utatxmapuruSadalilx) (sAmAnayxvAkayx, saMBAvanArUpa matutx parxshAnxthaRka vAkayxgaLalilx): 
\alnum{a} (sAmAnayx vAkayxdalilx) \eng{shall hear about it tomorrow} adara viSayavAgi namage nALe keVLibaruvudu, tiLiyuvudu yA tiLiyutatxde. \eng{shall hear from you soon?} nininxMda nanage sudidx beVga baruvudeV, barutatxdeyeV, baruvuduMToV? 
\alnum{b} (saMBAvanAthaRkavAgi) \eng{if I had let go, I should have been killed} hiDita biTuTxbiTiTxdadxre nAnu satutx hoVgutitxdedx. \eng{any one who should say so} hAge heVLuva yAvanAdarU. \eng{if he should happen to be there} avanu alilxdadxlilx. \eng{should I hear from you in that case?} A saMdaBaRdalilx, hAgAdalilx, nininxMda samAcAra tiLiyuva saMBavavuMTe? 
\alnum{c} (otitx heVLidAga) daqDhasaMkalapxsUcakavAgi: \eng{I shall return without fail} nAnu tapapxde hiMdiruguvenu, hiMdirugiyeV tiVrutetxVne. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{2} (madhayxmapuruSa matutx parxthamapuruSagaLalilx) mAtanADutitxruvavana iceCxyanunx sUcisuvudakikxMtalU hecAcxgi 
\banum
\alnum{a} daqDhasaMkalapxda sUcakavAgi: \eng{you shall not catch me again} nananxnunx niVnu matetx hiDiya lAguvudilalx; niVnu nananxnunx hiDiyalu nAnu matetx eDegoDuvudilalx. \eng{he should not have gone if I could have prevented it} avananunx taDeyalu nanage sAdhayxvAgididxdadxre, avanu hoVgalu AgutatxleV iralilalx. 
\alnum{b} AjAcnxsUcakavAgi: \eng{they shall not go} avaru hoVgakUDadu. \eng{I (you, he) should have been careful} nAnu (niVnu, avanu) ecacxrikeyiMdirabeVkAgitutx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} Ajecnx yA kataRvayx sUcisuvAga: \eng{thou shalt not steal} niVnu kadiyakUDadu. \eng{they shall obey} avaru vidheVyarAgi pAlisabeVku. 
\num{4} (madhayxmapuruSa parxshenxgaLalilx) (\kanmu\ beVDikeya rUpakekx badalAgi baLasuva) parxshAnxthaRka rUpavAgi: \eng{shall you go to England?} niVnu iMgelxMDige hoVgutitxVyA? 
\hyperdef{S}{shall(5)}{} 
\num{5} (yAvudeV puruSadalilx) udedxVshasUcaka upavAkayxdalilx \eng{may} yA \eng{might} sahAyaka kirxyApadagaLa badalu \eng{shall} yA \eng{should} parxyoVgavuMTu -- \udA\ \eng{in order that I (you, he) shall} \engit{or} \eng{should not be able} nAnu (niVnu, avanu) samathaRnAgadiraleMdu yA nanage, ninage, avanige, sAdhayxvAgadirali eMba udedxVshadiMda. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent

\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{it should seem (= it seems)} hAgeMdu toVrutatxde. 
\num{2} \eng{you should find} (\pArxparx) adanunx niVnu KaMDita patetx hacacxbeVku, ecacxra! 
\num{3} \eng{shall I ?} nAnu mADabeVkA? nAnu mADabeVkeMdu niVnu iciCxsutitxVyoV?

\bentry
\word[shoot(1)]{shoot} 
\pron{SUTf}
\gl{\kirx}
\expl{(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{shot} \ucAcx\ SATf) }


\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} 
\banum
\alnum{a} tiVra veVgavAgi, raBasadiMda -- kaLuhisu, ese, oge, horahAku, dabaubx: \eng{the bow shoots arrows} bilulx bANagaLanunx ogeyutatxde. \eng{the gun shoots out missiles} baMdUku kiSxpaNigaLanunx eseyutatxde. \eng{the coaches collided and shot out the passengers} A reYlugADigaLu parasapxra Dikikx hoDedu parxyANikaranunx horakekxsedubiTuTxvu. 
\alnum{b} (kiraNa \mo vugaLa \vi) biVru; sUsu; mUDisu: \eng{the sun shoots his rays} sUyaRnu tananx kiraNagaLanunx biVrutAtxne. \eng{trees shoot out their new twigs} maragaLu tamamx hosa reMbegaLanunx mUDisutatxve. \eng{he shot a glance at his neighbour} avanu tananx nereyavana(La) kaDege OrenoVTa biVrida. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} (kasa \mo vanunx bauTiTx, toTiTx, lAri \mo vugaLiMda) suri; celulx; ese; hAku: \eng{she shot the rubbish out of the basket} Ake kasakaDiDxyanunx bauTiTxyiMda horakekx suridaLu, esedaLu. 
\num{3} (kadada cilakavanunx BadarxpaDisalu yA tegeyalu, aguLiyanunx, tApALanunx) raBasadiMda -- hAku, taLuLx, nUku yA eLe. 
\num{4} (PiraMgi, bilulx, \mo vugaLiMda) guMDu, bANa, \mo vanunx -- eseyisu, hArisu, hAruvaMte mADu. 
\num{5} (bilulx, baMdUku, \mo vugaLa mUlaka) bANa, guMDu, \mo\ kiSxpaNiyanunx -- hArisu, parxkeSxVpisu, ese. 
\num{6} (vayxkitxyanunx yA pArxNiyanunx baMdUku, bilulx, \mo vugaLiMda) guMDu, bANa, \mo vanunx parxyoVgisi -- gAyagoLisu yA kolulx. 
\num{7} (vayxkitxyanunx shikeSxya rUpadalilx) baMdUkiniMda, bANadiMda -- kolulx. 
\num{8} (pode, jamiVnu, \mo vugaLalilxruva beVTe pArxNiyanunx, vanayx maqgavanunx) beVTeyADu; SikAri mADu; guMDikikx yA bANa hoDedu kolulx. 
\num{9} (\kanmu\ phuTfbAlf) ceMDanunx birusAgi odedu goVlf mADu. 
\num{10} (gAlfphx, \AmA) sutotxMdakekx nidiRSaTx saMKeyxya sokxVrf gaLisu, mADu. 
\num{11}(daqshayx, vayxkitx, \mo vara) calanacitarx yA BAvacitarx tege. 
\numi{12} (\ame, \AmA) 
\banum
\alnum{a} kArxYxpfsx, pUlf, \mo\ ATavADu. 
\alnum{b} (dALa) ese; hAku; uruLisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{13} (doVNiya \vi) (seVtuve, jalapAta, \mo vugaLa) aDiyalilx yA (iLijAru parxvAhada) meVle veVgavAgi sAgu; birusAgi hoVgu. 
\num{14} (\ashi) (mAdaka vasutxvanunx) tAneV, tanageV -- cucicxko. 
\num{15} (\AmA) (cwkadalilx, vaqtatxdalilx keMpudiVpa toVrisutitxdadxrU rasetxyanunx) -- dATu, hAdu hoVgu, atikarxmisi hoVgu. 
\num{16} (halageyoMdara ENanunx, aMcanunx OrekoVreyilalxdaMte) samanAgi yA karAruvAkAkxgi -- hatatxri hoDe, samaru, nayagoLisu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} veVgavAgi, birusAgi -- calisu; raBasadiMda -- baru yA hoVgu: \eng{the boat shot out from the creek} doVNiyu KAriyiMda horakekx raBasadiMda baMtu yA horaTitu. 
\numi{2} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (giDada \vi) kuDiyiDu; cigaroDe; konaru; ciguru; aMkurisu. 
\alnum{b} (giDada \vi) mogugx biDu; mogugx kacucx. 
\alnum{c} (ciguru, mogugxgaLa \vi) moLe; kANisiko. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} (kirxkeTf ceMDina \vi) nelakekx baDidu, puTaveVLade -- nelasamakekx uruLu, neladudadxkUkx ODu. 
\numi{4} (noVvina \vi) 
\banum
\alnum{a} caLuku -- koDu, huTiTxsu, niVDu. 
\alnum{b} (beVrAvudeV avayavada \vi) niMtu niMtu caLaku -- baru, noVyu, yAtaneyAgu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} idadxkikxdadxMte horaTuko; muMcAcu; horacAcu; cAciko: \eng{the cape shoots out all at once} A BUshiravu idadxkikxdadxMte muMcAcikoMDide. 
\num{6} (\kanmu\ nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx) baMdUku \mo vanunx hArisu, biDu: \eng{he shoots straight} avanu neVravAgi baMdUku hArisutAtxne, bANa biDutAtxne. 
\numi{7} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (bANa, guMDu, \mo\ kiSxpaNigaLa \vi, bilulx, baMdUku, \mo vugaLiMda)hAru; parxkeSxVpavAgu. 
\alnum{b} (baMdUkina \vi) hAru; hoDe. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{8} 
\banum
\alnum{a} baMdUkiniMda pArxNi yA vanayxmaqga beVTeyADu. 
\alnum{b} jamiVnu \mo vugaLalilx (pArxNiya) beVTeyADu; SikAri mADu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{9} (\kanmu\ phuTfbAlf) ceMDanunx goVlige birusAgi ode. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent 
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{shoot}! (\ame, \ashi) odaribiDu; birabirane heVLibiDu. 
\num{2} \eng{shoot ahead} (sapxdhiRgaLu \mo vara \vi) muMBAgakekx, muMcUNige, agarxsAthxnakekx -- beVga baru. 
\num{3} \eng{shoot a line} (\birx\ \AmA) yAvudanenxV vipariVta utepxrXVkiSxsi, naMbalAgadaMte yA ADaMbaradiMda -- heVLu, vaNiRsu. 
\numi{4} \eng{shoot down} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (vayxkitxyanunx) guMDikikx, guMDu hoDedu -- sAyisu, kolulx. 
\alnum{b} (PiraMgi \mo vanunx hArisi vimAna yA vimAnacAlakananunx) nelakikxLisu; hoDedu uruLisu; hoDedu keDavu. 
\alnum{c} (vayxkitx, yAvudeV salahe, \mo vakekx virudadhxvAgi) balavAgi vAdisu; pariNAmakAriyAgi, parxbala -- vAda hUDu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} \eng{shoot it out} (\ashi) niNARyakavAda koVvikadanadalilx toDagu, guMDina kALagadalilx BAgavahisu. 
\num{6} \eng{shoot one's} \hyperref{kandict_b.pdf}{B}{bolt(1) nuga(2)}{$^1$bolt}. 
\num{7} \eng{shoot one's cuffs} SaTiRna maNikaTuTx paTiTxyanunx (parxdashiRsalu, toVrisikoLaLxlu) odaru, koDavu. 
\num{8} \eng{shoot oneself in the foot} (\aupa) alakaSxyXdiMda, ajAgarUkateyiMda -- tanageV toMdare mADiko, tananx kAlanenxV muriduko, iruva sithxtiyanunx inanxSuTx keDisiko. 
\numi{9} \eng{shoot one's mouth off} (\ashi) 
\banum
\alnum{a} vipariVta yA laMgulagAmilalxde mAtanADu; hadudx hatoVTi ilalxde haraTu. 
\alnum{b} viveVcaneyilalxde haraTu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{10} \eng{shoot out} (\pArxparx) (tuTi \mo vanunx, \kanmu\ aNakisuva saluvAgi) horacAcu; muMdakekx niVDu. 
\num{11} \eng{shoot the breeze} (\engit{or} \eng{the bull)} (\kanu\ \ame, \AmA) mAtukateyADu; anwpacArikavAgi mAtanADu; sAMparxdAyika mAtukateyalilx toDagu. 
\num{12} \eng{shoot the cat} (\ashi) kakukx; vAMti mADu. 
\hyperdef{S}{shoot(1) pagu(13)}{} 
\num{13} \eng{shoot the moon} (\birx) pAvatimADabeVkAda bADige koDuvudanunx tapipxsikoLaLxlu rAtorxVrAtirx sAmAnugaLanenxlalx sAgisibiTuTx parAriyAgu 
\num{14} \eng{shoot the sun} akASxMshavanunx gotutxmADalu, naDuhagalige sariyAgi AkAshadalilx sUyaRna ucACxrXyavanunx kaMDuhiDi. 
\num{15} \eng{shoot through} (\AseTxrXV\ matutx nUyxsiZVleMDf) (\ashi) horaTuhoVgu; parAriyAgu; palAyana mADu; ODi hoVgu; gADi biDu; jAga KAlimADu; tale tapipxsikoMDu hoVgu. 
\numi{16} \eng{shoot up}

\banum

\bentry

\gl{\gu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} saraLa: 
\banum
\alnum{a} EkadhAtu savxrUpada; Eka GaTakada; saMyukatx yA misharxNa Agirada: \eng{simple substance} saraLa vasutx; EkadhAtu; EkaGaTaka; oMdeV mUla dhAtuvanonxLagoMDa vasutx. 
\alnum{b} Eka parxkirxyeya; oMdeV parxkirxyege yA yAvudeV parxkirxyege oMdeV bAri oLapaDuva. 
\alnum{c} sAmAnayx; EkAMshavuLaLx: \eng{simple sentence} saraLa vAkayx; oMdeV parxdhAna vAkayxvanonxLagoMDu, adhiVna yA upa vAkayxvilalxda vAkayx; oMdeV kataRqpada matutx oMdeV kirxyApadavanunx oLagoMDiruva vAkayx. 
\alnum{d} EkarAshi matutx EkaGAtagaLa: \eng{simple equation} saraLa samiVkaraNa; oMdeV GAtada oMdeV rAshiyanunx yA biVjasaMKeyxyanonxLagoMDa samiVkaraNa. 
\alnum{e} EkAMshavuLaLx; aviBakatx ilalxve avishelxVSayxvAda. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{2} saraLa; sulaBa; sAmAnayx; sAdhAraNa: 
\banum
\alnum{a} toDakAgilalxda; jaTilavalalxda: \eng{a simple style} saraLa, sulaBa -- sheYli. 
\alnum{b} alaMkAramayavalalxda; analaMkaqta; nirABaraNa; nirADaMbara: \eng{it is a simple , and not an ornate, style} adu saraLa sheYli, nirADaMbaravAda sheYli. \eng{simple beauty} analaMkaqta, nirADaMbara, sahaja -- swMdayaR. 
\alnum{c} BoVgavasutxgaLilalxda: \eng{a simple meal} sAdhAraNa, sAmAnayx -- BoVjana, UTa. \eng{the simple life} saraLa jiVvana; BoVgavasutxgaLu, kaqtaka vinoVdavilAsagaLu, \mo vanunx vajiRsi nisagaRsahajavAda bALanunx bALuvudu. 
\alnum{d} asaMkiVNaR; tiVra toDakina aMgagaLu yA BAgagaLu ilalxda; jaTilavAda racaneyalalxda: \eng{simple forms of life} (jiVva vikasana karxmadalilx) atayxlapx vikAsa hoMdiruva jiVvajAtigaLu; saraLa jiVvigaLu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} bariya; keVvala; shudadhx: \eng{the simple truth} shudadhx satayx. \eng{it is a simple majority, that is all} adu keVvala bahumata, aSeTx. \eng{his story is a simple invention} avana kathe bariya DoVMgi, shudadhx saqSaTxne. 
\numi{4} 
\banum
\alnum{a} saraLa; sAmAnayx; noVTa, naDenuDigaLalilx sAdhAraNavenisuva: \eng{he has a simple manner} Ata naDenuDigaLalilx sAmAnayxnaMtidAdxne. \eng{a simple attire} saraLavAda uDupu. 
\alnum{b} saraLa; sahaja; sAvxBAvika; niSakxpaTa; akaqtirxma; sAcA; kaqtakate ilalxda; sAdhuvAda: \eng{a simple person} niSakxpaTa manuSayx; saraLa vayxkitx; sAdhu, BoVLe -- manuSayx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} tiLivaLike yA anuBava ilalxda; ajacnx; daDaDx; mUDha; maMdabaudidhx; ananuBavi: \eng{I am not so simple as to be taken in so easily} aSuTx sarAgavAgi moVsahoVguvaSuTx ajacnx, ananuBavi nAnalalx. 
\num{6} saraLa; sulaBa; aritukoLaLxlu yA mADalu sarAgavAda, kaSaTxveVnU alalxda: \eng{he gave a simple explanation} (ariyalu) sulaBavAda vivaraNeyanunx avanu koTaTx. \eng{the problem is very simple} A samaseyx bahaLa saraLa; A samaseyxyanunx bageharisuvudu bahu sulaBa. \eng{the malady can be cured by a simple technique} sulaBa taMtarxdiMda A vAyxdhiyanunx guNapaDisabahudu. 
\numi{7} 
\banum
\alnum{a} sAmAnayx; keLadajeRya; nimanx vagaRda; diVna sithxtiya; gaNayx vagaRdavaralalxda: \eng{they are simple folk belonging to the lowest strata of society} avaru samAjada atayxMta keLadajeRgaLige seVrida diVnajana. 
\alnum{b} alapx; gaNaniVyavalalxda; mahatatxravalalxda: \eng{her simple efforts to please the guests were quite charming} atithigaLanunx saMtoVSa paDisalu Ake mADida alapx parxyatanxgaLu moVhaka vAgidudxvu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{8} (\savi) saraLa: 
\banum
\alnum{a} oMdeV oMdu aMgavuLaLx. 
\alnum{b} (kAyi athavA haNiNxna \vi) oMdu shalAkeyiMda Ada. 
\eanum

\num{3} ajacnxte; ajAcnxna; anuBavashUnayxte; viveVkarAhitayx; tiLivaLike, anuBava, viveVcanegaLu ilalxdiruvudu: \eng{his simplicity made him an easy dupe} avana ajAcnxna ananuBavagaLiMdAgi avanu (yAradeV) vaMcanege sulaBavAgi pakAkxgutitxdadx. 
\num{4} saraLate; sAdhAraNatana; (veVSa, BASe, naDenuDigaLalilx) nayanAjUkilalxdiruvike: \eng{his simplicity was a sharp contrast to their refined manners} avana saraLate avara nAjUkAda naDenuDigaLige tiVkaSxNXvAgi vayxtirikatx vAgitutx. 
\num{5} saraLate; akaqtakate; sahajate; saraLa savxBAva: \eng{everyone looked up to him for the simplicity of his character} avana naDateya saraLatanakAkxgi elalxrU avananunx gwravisutitxdadxru. 
\num{6} akaqtakate; akaqtirxmate; niSakxpaTate; sAcAtana; yAva kaqtakateyU ilalxdiruvudu: \eng{his simplicity was totally free from all affectation} avana sahajateyalilx leVshamAtarxvU kaqtakate iralilalx. 
\num{7} saraLate; nirADaMbara; alaMkAra ADaMbaragaLilalxdiru vudu: \eng{the simplicity of this style, its freedom from cumbersome ornamentation, lends it a dignity and vigour} I sheYliya saraLate, alaMkAragaLa BAradiMda adu vimukatxvAgiruvudu, adakokxMdu GanateyanUnx OjasasxnUnx taMdukoTiTxde. 
\num{8} saraLate; BoVgavasutxgaLanunx vajiRsi virakitxyiMda badukuvudu.

\alnum{b} AturavAgi kaLacu, tegedu hAku: \eng{slip on} (\engit{or} \eng{over) a shirt} beVga SaTuR tagulisiko. \eng{slip off a shirt} beVga SaTuR kaLacu. . kaLaciko; tapipxsiko; jAriko; nuNuciko; keYkoDu; gasutx koDu: \eng{dog slips his collar} nAyi koraLapaTiTxyiMda kaLacikoLuLxtatxde. \eng{the prisoner slipped his guard} keYdi avana kAvalugAranige gasutx koTaTx, kAvalugAraniMda tapipxsikoMDa. \eng{the point had slipped my attention} A aMsha nananx gamanadiMda tapipxsikoMDitutx, jAritutx. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (udedxVshadiMdalalxde yA AkasimxkavAgi, \kanmu\ savxlapx dUra) jAru; jarugu. 
\num{2} (AkasimxkvAgi jAri) nele tapupx; pavaNu tapupx; kAlu jAru: \eng{slipped in the mud} maNiNxnalilx kAlu jArida. 
\num{3} jArikoMDu hoVgu; jAriko; jAri hoVgu; jArutatx sari: \eng{as the door closes the catch slips into place} kada mucicxkoMDaMte hiDike tananx nelege jArikoLuLxtatxde. \eng{slipped into her nightdress} rAtirxyuDupinoLakekx jArikoMDaLu. 
\num{4} jAriko; nuNuciko; kaLaciko; nusuLu; tapipxhoVgu; hiDitakekx sikakxde hoVgu: \eng{the eel slipped through his fingers} hAvumiVnu avana keYjAri nusuLikoMDitu. \eng{let reins slip out of his hands} lagAmu keYyiMda kaLacikoLaLxlu biTaTx. 
\num{5} kadudx hoVgu; nusuLu; kANadaMte, gotAtxgadaMte yA sadidxlalxdaMte yA caTaTxne -- sari, horaTuhoVgu yA kaLeduhoVgu: \eng{how time slips away}! kAla heVge saridu hoVgutatxde, kaLedu hoVgutatxde! \eng{slip out of the room} koTaDiyiMda sadidxlalxde horaTuhoVgu. \eng{slip across to the shop} edurina aMgaDige beVga hoVgu. \eng{errors will slip in} gotAtxgadaMte tapupxgaLu nusuLibarutatxve. 
\numi{6} 
\banum
\alnum{a} ajAgarUkateyiMda -- tapupxmADu, tapupx, biTuTx biDu: \eng{slips now and then in his grammar} AgAgegx vAyxkaraNadalilx tapupxtAtxne. 
\alnum{b} biVLu; iLiguMdu; sAdhAraNa maTaTxdiMda keLakekx iLi. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\hyperdef{S}{slip(1) pagu(1)}{} 
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{let slip} 
\banum
\alnum{a} togalapaTiTx kaLacu; hiDidiTiTxruva bAriniMda biDugaDe mADu. 
\alnum{b} bAyitapipx nuDi; ecacxrikeyilalxde, ajAgarUkateyiMda -- nuDi. 
\alnum{c} (sadavakAshavanunx) kaLeduko; tapipxsiko; hALu mADiko. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{let slip the dogs of war} (\kAparx) yudadhx pArxraMBisu. 
\numi{3} \eng{let slip through one's fingers} 
\banum
\alnum{a} hiDitadiMda jAri, nuNucikoMDu, tapipxsikoMDu hoVgalu biDu. 
\alnum{b} (sadavakAsha \mo vu) nuNuciko; tapipxhoVgu; hiDitakekx sikakxde, keYjAri -- hoVgu: \eng{the opportunity slipped through his fingers} sadavakAsha avana keYjAri hoVyitu. 
\eanum
\numie

\numi{6} \eng{slip by}

\numie

\num{6} (hAvinaMte) vakarxvakarxvAgiruva; DoMkuDoMkAda; tiruvu muruvAda.

\bentry
\word[snap(1)]{snap} 
\pron{sAnxYxpf}
\gl{\kirx}
\expl{(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{snapped;} \vakaq\ \eng{snapping}).}


\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} laTaTxne muri; caTaTxne kaDi: \eng{snap a stick} kaDiDxyanunx laTaTxne muri. 
\num{2} shabadx barisu; paTf eninxsu; caTAreninxsu: \eng{snap pistol} pisUtxlanunx paTf eninxsu. \eng{snap whip} cAvaTiyanunx caTAreninxsu. 
\num{3} sashabadxvAgi, DabArane, dopapxne, daDArane -- hAku, mucucx yA tege: \eng{snap the clasp} cilaka yA koMDi yA kokekxyanunx dhaDArane hAku. \eng{snap one's teeth together} halulxgaLanunx kaTamamxne kUDisu, kacucx. 
\num{4} siDukiniMda heVLu; kirikiriyiMda yA siDiguTuTxtAtx -- mAtADu: \eng{the customer snapped his complaints} girAki tananx dUrugaLanunx siDukiniMda heVLida. 
\num{5} curukAgi, kiSxparxvAgi yA beVga -- calisu. 
\num{6} sarakakxne phoVToV tege; kaSxNadalilx CAyAcitarx hiDi. 
\num{7} (\ame, kAlecxMDATa) ceMDanunx ATadalilx toDagisalu taTaTxne hiMdakekx ode yA hiMdakekx pAsu koDu. 
\num{8} kacicx hAku; kaDidubiDu; taTakakxne kaDidu beVpaRDisu. 
\num{9} [cUrupAru, kirxkeTiTxnalilx ceMDu, (\rUpa) vAyxpAra \mo vanunx] taTaTxne kasiduko; AturavAgi etitxko; gabakakxne tegeduko; Pakakxne hiDi. 
\num{10} mAtu kaDi; aDaDxbAyi hAku; mAtADutitxruvavananunx mAtu mugisalu biDade madhayxdalelxV utatxra koDalu pArxraMBisu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} laTaTxne muriduhoVgu; caTaTxne kaDiduhoVgu; paTakakxne kitutxhoVgu: \eng{the branch snapped} reMbe laTaTxne muridu hoVyitu. \eng{the wire snaps} taMti caTaTxne kaDiduhoVgutatxde, kitutxhoVgutatxde. 
\num{2}caTf, Dabf, paTArf, caTArf -- enunx; caTaguTuTx: \eng{pistol snaps} pisUtxlu DabArenunxtatxde. \eng{whip snaps} cAvaTi caTArenunxtatxde. 
\num{3} DabArane mucicxko yA tegeduko; dopapxne hAkiko yA tereduko: \eng{the door snapped behind her} avaLa hiMde bAgilu dabArane hAkikoMDitu. 
\num{4} (vayxkitx) siDuguTuTx; siDuku mAtADu; haritavAgi, kaTuvAgi -- mAtanADu; cucucxvaMte, noVyuvaMte, reVgi, kaDiDx murida hAge -- mAtADu yA utatxra koDu: \eng{did not mean to snap at you} ninonxDane kaTuvAgi mAtanADuva udedxVshaviralilalx. 
\num{5} (\kanmu\ nAyi \mo vugaLa \vi) gabakakxne kacucx; Pakakxne, kaTumamxne -- kaDi; shabadxvAguvaMte taTaTxne kacucx, kaDi: \eng{dog snapped viciously} nAyi taTakakxne balavAgi kacicxtu. 
\num{6} curukAgi calisu: \eng{snap into action} kiSxparxvAgi kAyoRVnumxKanAgu. \eng{snap to attention} beVga `sAvadhAna' da niluvu nilulx. 
\num{7} (\CA) sarakakxne phoVToV tege; (\kanmu) vayxkitx yA vasutx citarx tegeyalu aNiyAgadiruvAga kiSxparxvAgi citarx tege. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{snap at} 
\banum
\alnum{a} kacacxhoVgu; kaDiyalu parxyatinxsu. 
\alnum{b} siDukiniMda mAtADu; reVgi murida hAge mAtanADu. 
\alnum{c} (gALa, parxsAtxpa, avakAsha, \mo vanunx) gapapxne hiDi; AturadiMda hiDi; AseyiMda garxhisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{snap into it} (\ashi) (horaDalu, calisalu) beVga shurumADu. 
\numi{3} \eng{snap off} 
\banum
\alnum{a} laTaTxne -- muridu, kaDidu hAku. 
\alnum{b} taTaTxne -- kacucx; kacicx kaDidu hAku. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{4} \eng{snap off a person's head} (\engit{or} \eng{nose)} (\kanmu\ \rUpa.) 
\banum
\alnum{a} (obabxnu mAtADutitxruvAga) koVpadiMda naDuve bAyihAku; mAtu kaDi. 
\alnum{b} oraToraTAgi utatxra koDu; muKa muri. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} \eng{snap one's fingers} (\kanmu\ saMgiVta \mo vugaLalilx layada virAma tuMbalu) ciTike -- hAku, hoDe. 
\numi{6} \eng{snap one's fingers at} 
\banum

\alnum{b} (\rUpa) (obabxnanunx) tirasAkxradiMda kANu; kaDegaNisu; upeVkiSxsu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{7} \eng{snap out} siDukiniMda heVLu; siDuguTiTxkoMDu odaru. 
\numi{8} \eng{snap out of} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (\ashi) (manoVBAva, rUDhi, \mo vanunx) tore; biDu; tayxjisu. 
\alnum{b} (\AmA) savxsithxtige bA, maraLu; tananx rUDhiya tALemx, AroVgayx, ceYtanayx, ulAlxsa, \mo vanunx punaH paDeduko. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{9} \eng{snap up} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (bele, vAyxpArada opapxMda, \mo vanunx) taTaTxne, gapapxne -- hiDiduko; kUDaleV yA AturavAgi opipxko, aMgiVkarisu. 
\alnum{b} gapapxne yA AturAturavAgi -- hiDiduko, tegeduko, etitxko. 
\alnum{c} aDaDxbAyi hAku; inonxbabxnu mAtu mugisuvudaroLage naDuveyeV mAtu pArxraMBisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng
\eentry
