\bentry
\word[so(1)]{so} 
\pron{soV}
\gl{\kirxvi}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} aSuTx; iSuTx; aSoTxMdu; iSoTxMdu; A, I -- maTiTxge: \eng{why are you so angry} niVneVke iSoTxMdu koVpagoMDididxVye? \eng{they were so pleased that they gave us a bonus} avarige eSuTx saMtoVSavAgitetxMdare avaru namage oMdu boVnasf koTaTxru; namage oMdu boVnasf koDuva maTiTxge avaru saMtuSaTxrAgidadxru. \eng{so many men, so many minds} eSoTxMdu maMdiyoV aSoTxMdu manasusxgaLu, aBipArxyagaLu, BAvanegaLu. 
\num{2} (niSeVdhavAciyoDane) aSuTx; aSaTxra -- maTiTxge, tanaka, varege: \eng{was not so late as I expected} nAnu niriVkiSxsidaSuTx taDavAgalilalx. \eng{am not so eager as you} ninanxSuTx nAnu kAtaranAgilalx. \eng{so expensive that few can afford it} eSuTx dubAriyeMdare adanunx koLaLxlu yArigU sAdhayxvilalx. \eng{so small as to be invisible} kANisadaSuTx cikakxdAgide. \eng{am not so foolish as to agree to that} nAnu adakekx opipxge niVDuvaSuTx daDaDxnalalx. \eng{did not expect to live so long} aSuTx diVGaRkAla badukuvudanunx niriVkiSxsalilalx. 
\num{3} aMte; hAge; hiVge: \eng{I want to leave and so does she} nAnu hoVgabeVkeMdidedxVne, aMteyeV avaLU. \eng{you said it was good, and so it is} adu cenAnxgideyeMdu niVnu heVLide, adu hAgeyeV ide. \eng{why are you panting so ?} niVneVke hiVge Edusiru biDutitxdidxVye? \eng{as the tree falls, so it must lie} mara heVge biVLutatxdeyoV hAgeyeV adu bidudxkoMDirabeVku. \eng{so , and so only, can it be done} hAge, matutx hAge mAtarxveV, adanunx mADalu sAdhayx. 
\num{4} iSuTx; aSuTx; aSaTxra maTiTxge: \eng{so high you cannot reach it} ninage eTukalAradaSuTx etatxradalilx. \eng{have known him since he was so high} avanu (keYyiMda toVrisutAtx) iSuTx etatxradavanAgidAdxginiMda nAnu avananunx balelx. 
\num{5}bahaLa; tuMba; eSoTxV (paTuTx): \eng{so many worlds}! eSoTxMdu loVkagaLu. \eng{so much to do} eSoTxMdu kelasa (mADabeVkAgide). \eng{I am so glad} nanage tuMba saMtoVSavAgide. \eng{she is so beautiful} avaLu eSuTx celuve! \eng{that is ever so easy} adu bahaLa sulaBa. \eng{that is ever so much better} adu bahaLa meVlu. 
\num{6} (sithxtiyanunx sUcisuva \kirx gaLoDane) hAge; aMte; vaNiRsida sithxtiyalilx, riVtiyalilx, parxkAra: \eng{stand just so} savxlapx hAge niMtuko. \eng{am not very fond of it, but may become so} nanage adu bahaLa iSaTxvAdudeVnU alalx, Adare hAge AguvaMtAgabahudu. \eng{he is better so} avanu aMtiruvudeV meVlu. \eng{perhaps, it is not so} pArxyashaH adu hAgilalx. 
\num{7} (\eng{say, think} modalAda \kirx gaLoDane) hAge; aMte; hAgeMdu; hiVgeMdu; aMtu; iMtu; hiMde heVLidaMte yA nirUpisidaMte: \eng{so he said} avanu aMte heVLida. \eng{I think so} nAnu hAge BAvisutetxVne, aMdukoLuLxtetxVne. \eng{so I should hope} hAgeMdu nAnu naMbabeVku, niriVkiSxsabeVku. 
\num{8} hAge; hiVge; aMte; A riVti; A parxkAra: \eng{so run that you may win} gelulxvaMte ODu. \eng{so it was I became a sailor} nAnu nAvikanAdadudx A riVtiyalilx. 
\num{9} jotege; matutx; saha; kUDa; nijavAgi; vAsatxvadalilx: \eng{well, so did I} sari, nAnu kUDa adanunx mADide. \eng{yes, I denied it, but} (\engit{or} \eng{and) so did you} nAnu adanunx ilalxveMde, Adare (matutx) niVnU adanenxV mADide. \eng{your birthday? so it is} ninanx huTiTxda hababxveV? hwdu; adu nija. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{and so} (\pArxparx) AmeVle; anaMtara; taruvAya; baLika: \eng{and so to dinner} AmeVle UTakekx (hoVdaru). \eng{and so to bed} baLika malagalu (hoVdaru). 
\hypertarget{so pagu2}{} 
\numi{2} \eng{and so forth} 
\banum
\alnum{a} inUnx hAgeyeV, hiVgeyeV; itAyxdi; matutx aMthavu; modalAdavu. 
\alnum{b} aveV riVtigaLalilx; avugaLaMtaha vidhAnagaLalilx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} \eng{(and) so much of} -ra aSuTx matutx -ra iSuTx; oMdu KacitavAda Adare iSuTx eMdu sapxSaTxvAgi heVLadiruva saMKeyx, motatx, \mo vu: \eng{so much of one ingredient and so much of another} oMdu parikaradudx aSuTx matutx inonxMdaradudx iSuTx. 
\num{4} \eng{and so on} = \hyperlink{so pagu2}{?pagu? \((2)\)}. 
\num{5} \eng{at so much} iSuTx; iSaTxraMte; aSuTx; aSaTxraMte: \eng{at so much a week} vArakakxSuTx. \eng{at so much a head} talegiSaTxraMte. 
\num{6} \hyperref{kandict_e.pdf}{E}{ever nuga(7)}{ever} \eng{so.}. 
\num{7} \hyperref{kandict_e.pdf}{E}{every nuga(6)}{every} \eng{so often.} 
\hypertarget{so pagu8}{} 
\num{8} \eng{(in) so} \hyperref{kandict_f.pdf}{F}{far(1) pagu(5)}{$^1$far} \eng{as.} 
\num{9} \eng{I suppose so} (anumAnisutAtx opipxge sUcisuva parxyoVga) nanagU hAgeyeV -- toVrutatxde, kANisutatxde, aninxsutatxde. 
\num{10} \eng{(it is} \mo vanunx adhAyxhAra mADi) \eng{if so (= if it is so )} hAgidadxlilx. \eng{how so ?} (adu) heVge? \eng{why so ?} (adu) Eke hAge? \eng{`he went off yesterday'. `so?' (= `is that so ?')} `avanu nenenx horaTuhoVda'. `hwdeV?'. 
\num{11} \eng{I told you so} adanunx hAgeMdu modaleV nAnu ninage heVLidedx, ecacxrisidedx (nAnu ninage ecacxrike heVLidudx vayxthaRvAyitu eMbathaRdalilx). 
\numi{12} \eng{just so} 
\banum
\alnum{a} bahaLa ecacxrikeyiMda mADalAgide yA vayxvasethxgoLisalAgide. 
\alnum{b} (samamxti sUcisuva mayARdeya mAtAgi) sari(yAgide); samamxta(vAgide). 
\eanum
\numie
\num{13} \eng{more so} (adeV vasutx \mo vugaLu) inUnx hecucx; inUnx hecicxna maTaTxdalilx; inUnx adhikavAgi. 
\num{14} \eng{not so} hAgirada; aSuTx Agilalxda; niriVkiSxsidaSuTx yA heVLidadxSuTx Agirada: \eng{not so difficult} aSuTx kaSaTxvalalxda. 
\hypertarget{so pagu15}{} 
\numi{15} \eng{not so much as} 
\banum
\alnum{a} -kikxMta kaDime; aSiTxlalxde: \eng{he is not so much discontented as unsatisfied} avanige taqpitxyAgilalxveV vinA ataqpitxyAgilalx. \eng{he is not so much un-intelligent as uneducated} avanu avidAyxvaMtaneV vinA daDaDxnalalx; avanige korateyAgiruvudu vidAyxBAyxsa, baudidhxyalalx. 
\alnum{b} aSUTx, adU, saha, kUDa: \eng{did not so much as glance at it} adara kaDe noVDi kUDa noVDalilalx, noVDalU ilalx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{16} \eng{or so} (motatx, saMKeyx, \mo vanunx sUcisuva shabadxgaLa taruvAya \parx) sumAru; hecucx kaDame: \eng{send me ten} \engit{or} \eng{so} nanage sumAru \eng{10} kaLuhisu. \eng{a pound} \engit{or} \eng{so will do} savxlapx hecucxkaDame oMdu pwMDf sAku. 
\numi{17} \eng{so as to} 
\banum
\alnum{a} aSuTx; A parxmANadalilx: \eng{not so big a fool as to believe that} adanunx naMbauvaSuTx daDaDxnalalx. 
\alnum{b} aMte; hAge; A riVti: \eng{I will have everything ready so as not to keep you waiting} ninanxnunx kAyisadaMte nAnu elalxvanUnx sidadhxpaDisirutetxVne. 
\alnum{c} udedxVshadiMda; hAgAgalu; adakAkxgi: \eng{put it so as not to offend him} avanige asamAdhAna vAgadaMte heVLu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{18} \eng{so be it} (opipxge, vidhiyilalxde samamxtisuvudu, \mo vugaLalilx) sari, Agali; hAgeyeV Agali; tathAsutx. 
\num{19} \eng{so -called} (sAmAnayxvAgi, aneVka veVLe tapApxgi) kareyalAgiruva; karediruva; enanxlAda; heVLalAda; hesaru hoMdiruva. 
\num{20} \eng{so} \hyperref{kandict_f.pdf}{F}{far(1) pagu(6)}{far}. 
\num{21} \eng{so far forth as} (\pArxparx) = \hyperlink{so pagu8}{?pagu?\(8)\)}. 
\num{22} \eng{so far from} adara badalu, badalAgi; tiVra virudadhxvAgi: \eng{so far from being a help, he was a hindrance} sahAyavAgiruvudara badalu avanu oMdu aDiDxyAda. 
\num{23} \eng{so long}! (\AmA) (matetx BeVTiyAguvavarege) namasAkxra!

\banum

\num{2} iSaTxralelxV; savxlapxdaralelxV; sadayxdalelxV; anatikAladalilxyeV: \eng{we shall soon know the result} PalitAMshavanunx nAvu sadayxdalelxV ariyutetxVve. 
\num{3}(vAcayxvoV sUcayxvoV Ada hoVlikeyoDane) manasAre; saMtoVSavAgi; saMtoVSadiMda; KuSiyAgi; iSaTxdiMda: \eng{I would just as soon stay at home (as go)} (hoVguvudakikxMta) saMtoVSavAgi maneyalelxV idedxVnu. \eng{I would soon er die than let my father find out this folly of mine} I nananx aviveVkavanunx namamxpapx kaMDukoLuLxvudakekx munanxveV saMtoVSadiMda satetxVnu. \eng{which would you sooner} (\engit{or} \eng{soon est) do?} (ivugaLa peYki) yAvudanunx mADalu ninagiSaTx? 
\num{4} hotitxge muMce; beVga: \eng{what makes you come so soon ?} iSuTx beVga ninanxnunx ililxge baramADida kAraNaveVnu? \eng{you spoke a bit too soon} niVnu savxlapx muMceyeV mAtanADibiTeTx. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{as} (\engit{or} \eng{so) soon as} A(da) kUDaleV; A kaSxNaveV; takaSxNaveV; Ada oDaneyeV: \eng{I came as soon as I heard of it} adanunx nAnu keVLida kUDaleV baMdubiTeTx. \eng{he will get there as soon as they do} avaru alilxge talupidoDaneyeV avanU taluputAtxne. \eng{I did not arrive so} (\engit{or} \eng{as) soon as I expected} nAnu niriVkiSxsidaSuTx beVga talupalilalx. \eng{he drops his fine theories so (or as) soon as they clash with his interests} avanu tananx sogasAda sidAdhxMtagaLiMda tananx sAvxthaRkekx dhakekx baMda kUDaleV avugaLa keYbiDutAtxne. \eng{as soon as ever there is any talk of paying he cools down} haNa teruva mAtu baMdoDaneyeV avanu taNaNxgAgutAtxne. 
\num{2} \eng{no sooner... than} A kaSxNadalelxV; A kUDaleV; tatfkaSxNaveV; tatfkaSxNadalelxV: \eng{no sooner said than done} heVLida kUDaleV, Ayitu -- aMtiTuTxko, aMtanunx, aMta tiLiduko. \eng{it was no sooner said than done} heVLida utatxra kaSxNadalelxV adanunx mADiyU Ayitu. 
\num{3} \eng{sooner} \engit{or} \eng{later} iMdoV muMdoV; eMdAdarU; (muMde) eMdoV oMdu dina; beVganeyoV taDavAgiyoV; hiMcoV muMcoV: \eng{you will repent it sooner} \engit{or} \eng{later} iMdoV muMdoV, eMdAdarU niVnu adakekx pashAcxtAtxpa paDutitxVye. \eng{sooner} \engit{or} \eng{later we must all die} hiMcoV muMcoV nAvelAlx sAyaleVbeVku. 
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\num{4} (haDaganunx) kUgi karedu -- saMkeVta koDu, samAcAra tiLisu. 
\num{5} (\pArxparx) (vayxkitxya naDavaLike, saMdaBaR, \mo vugaLa \vi) iMthavaneMdu yA iMthadeMdu -- heVLu, sUcisu, toVrisu, parxkaTisu: \eng{his conduct speaks him generous} avanu udAri eMbaudanunx avana naDavaLikeyeV heVLutatxde, toVrisutatxde. 
\num{6} (\pArxparx) (yAvudakekxV) kuruhAgiru; sAkiSxyAgiru: \eng{the loud laugh that speaks the vacant mind} ciMteyilalxda, nirALavAda, manasisxge kuruhAda keVke, gaTiTxyAda nagu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} mAtADu; nuDi; usuru: \eng{he is unable to speak after his stroke} avanige lakAvx hoDeda baLika, pAshavxRvAyu tagulida baLika, mAtADalu ashakatxnAgidAdxne. \eng{I wish you would speak distinctly} niVnu sapxSaTxvAgi mAtADidare cenAnxgirutatxde. \eng{Hello, (this is) Narayan speaking} (TeliphoVnf) haloV, mAtanADutitxruvavanu nAnu, nArAyaNf. 
\num{2} (vayxkitxyoDane) mAtADu; saMBASisu; saMvAda naDesu: \eng{I will speak to the Director about this matter} I viSayavAgi nideRVshakaroDane mAtADutetxVne. 
\num{3} (yAvudeV viSayavanunx baraha \mo\ rUpadalilx) heVLu; tiLisu; parxsAtxpisu: \eng{speaks of it in his novel} tananx kAdaMbariyalilx adanunx parxsAtxpisutAtxne. 
\num{4} (saBe, nAyxyAdhipati, nAyxyavicAraNA maMDali, \mo vugaLa edurinalilx, samumxKadalilx) mAtADu; BASaNa mADu: \eng{spoke for an hour} oMdu GaMTeya kAla mAtADida, BASaNa mADida. 
\num{5} yAvudaradeV paravAgi yA yAvudanenxV samathiRsutAtx mAtADu: \eng{I shall speak for the resolution} nAnu masUdeya paravAgi mAtanADutetxVne, masUdeyanunx samathiRsutetxVne. \eng{he has a good speaking voice} avanige BASaNakekx anukUlavAda dhavxni ide. 
\num{6} (beVTenAyiya \vi) ULu; ULiDu; baguLu. 
\num{7} (saMgiVta vAdayxgaLa \vi) nAda mADu; dani koDu. 
\num{8} (baMdUku \mo vugaLa \vi) sadudx mADu; sadAdxgu. 
\num{9} (\AmA) tegaLu; dUSisu: \eng{spoke to them about their lateness} avara CAnasada bagegx dUSisada. 
\num{10} mAtina yA barahada mUlaka (beVrobabx vayxkitx \mo vara) BAvane, aBipArxya, anisikegaLanunx -- tiLisu, heVLu, aBivayxkitxgoLisu, vayxkatxpaDisu: \eng{speaks for our generation} namamx talemArinavara aBipArxyagaLanunx vayxkatxpaDisutAtxne. 
\num{11} (\kAparx) BAva \mo vanunx tiLisu; parxBAva biVru; muTuTx; taTuTx: \eng{the sunset spoke to her} sUyARsatx avaLanunx taTiTxtu. \eng{Nature spoke to Lucy} parxkaqti lUsige tiLisitu (lUsiya meVle pariNAma biVritu). 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{ill-spoken} keTaTx mAtugaLanAnxDuva; duBARSiyAda. 
\num{2} \eng{not} (\engit{or} \eng{nothing) to speak of} heVLikoLuLxvaMthadeVnU ilalx; heVLikoLuLxvaMtha (doDaDx) viSayaveVnU alalx; lekakxkekx tegedu koLuLxva viSayaveVnU alalx; heVLuvaMthadudx (vAsatxvikavAgi) EnU ilalx; heVLabahudAda visheVSaveVnU ilalx. 
\num{3} \eng{smooth-spoken} nayavAgi mAtanADuva; maqduBASiyAda. 
\num{4} \eng{so to} \hyperlink{say(1) pagu(37)}{$^1$say} \eng{(or speak).} 
\numi{5} \eng{speak for} 
\banum
\alnum{a} obabxna paravAgi mAtanADu; obabxna vakAtxranAgiru; obabxna BAva-BAvanegaLanunx, iMgita manoVratha gaLanunx (beVrobabxrige) heVLu, tiLiyapaDisu. 
\alnum{b} = \hyperref{kandict_b.pdf}{B}{bespeak}{bespeak}. 
\hypertarget{speak pagu6}{} 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} \eng{speak for itself} savxtaH sAkiSxyAgiru; beVre sAkiSx beVkAgilalxdiru: \eng{the course pursued by him speaks for itself} Ata hiDidiruva hAdi savxtaH sAkiSxyAgide. 
\numi{7} \eng{speak for oneself} 
\banum
\alnum{a} tananx savxMta aBipArxya mAtarx -- tiLisu, heVLu, koDu. 
\alnum{b} itarara aBipArxyagaLanunx parxtinidhisalu toDagabeVDa:\eng{I can only speak for myself; I am not concerned with other's views} nAnu nananx savxMta aBipArxyavanunx mAtarx heVLabalelx; itarara aBipArxyada goDave nanage beVkilalx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{speak one's mind} manasisxnalilxdadxdadxnunx mucucxmare yilalxde, sapxSaTxvAgi, nidARkiSxNayxvAgi -- heVLibiDu; aBipArxyavanunx tiLisalu, heVLalu hiMtegeyabeVDa, dAkiSxNayxpaDabeVDa. 
\hypertarget{speak pagu9}{} 
\numi{9} \eng{speak out} 
\banum
\alnum{a} gaTiTxyAgi bAyibiTuTx -- heVLu; sapxSaTxvAgi heVLu. 
\alnum{b} = \hyperlink{speak pagu6}{?pagu?\((6)\)}. 
\alnum{c} savxMta aBipArxya tiLisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{10} \eng{speak one} \hyperref{kandict_f.pdf}{F}{fair(5) pagu(4)}{$^5$fair}. 
\numi{11} \eng{speak to} 
\banum
\alnum{a} obabxnoDane mAtADu, saMBASisu. 
\alnum{b} oMdu viSayakekx sAkiSxyAgi mAtADu: \eng{I can speak to his having been there} avanu alilxdadx eMbaudakekx sAkiSxyAgi nAnu mAtADabalelx. 
\alnum{c} oMdu viSayavanunx kuritu mAtADu, heVLu: \eng{I will speak to that point later} A viSayavanunx, aMshavanunx kuritu AmeVle heVLutetxVne, mAtADutetxVne. 
\alnum{d} (\AmA) CiVmAri mADu, tarATege tegeduko: \eng{has he been misbehaving? I will speak to him about it} avanu ayoVgayxvAgi naDedukoLuLxtitxdAdxneye? hAgAdare nAnu avanige CiVmAri mADutetxVne. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{12} \eng{speak up} = \hyperlink{speak pagu9}{?pagu? \((9)\)}. 
\num{13} \eng{speak volumes} (saMgati, satAyxMsha, \mo vugaLa \vi) athaRpUNaRvAgiru; mahatatxvXpUNaRvAgiru: \eng{his silence speaks volumes} Atana mwna (tuMba) athaRpUNaRvAgide.

\banum

\alnum{b} anukUlakara vAtAvaraNadalilxrisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum

\bentry
\word[spirit(1)]{spirit} 
\pron{sipxriTf}
\gl{\nA}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (pArxNigaLa, vayxkitxgaLa) usiru; pArxNa; jiVva. 
\numi{2} (vayxkitxya) 
\banum
\alnum{a} Atamx; ceVtana; Bwtavalalxda aMsha: \eng{peace be to his departed spirit} divaMgatana Atamxkekx shAMtiyuMTAgali. 
\alnum{b} aMtaHkaraNa; manasusx; AMtayaR; aMtaraMga: \eng{in the spirit} manadalilx; AMtayaRdalilx; aMtaraMga dalilx: \eng{I shall be with you in the spirit} manasA, AMtayaRdalilx, aMtaraMgadalilx, nAnu ninonxDaneyeV irutetxVne. \eng{he groaned in spirit} avanu manasisxnalelxV yAtanepaTaTx. \eng{he was vexed in spirit} avanu AMtayaRdalilx duguDagoMDa. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} (sharxdedhx , utAsxha, niSeThx, AdashaR, \mo\ sherxVSaThx guNagaLuLaLx) vayxkitx; jiVvi: \eng{he was one of the most ardent spirits of his time} Ata tananx kAlada atayxMta utAsxhi vayxkitxgaLalolxbabxnAgidadx. \eng{it was a meeting of the choicest spirits} adoMdu atayxMta niSAThxvaMtara samAveVshavAgitutx. 
\num{4} amUtaRceVtana; Atamx; cinAmxtarx savxrUpi; Bwtavilalxda Adare viveVcane, baudidhxshakitx iruva vayxkitx; ceVtana savxrUpi; keVvala cinamxya: \eng{God is the supreme spirit} BagavaMta, paramAtamx parama cinamxya. 
\num{5} amUtaR -- vayxkitx, jiVvi; (pheVri, yakaSx, gaMdhavaR, apasxrAdigaLu, BUtaperxVta pishAcAdigaLu, \mo) alwkika jiVvi, vayxkitx: \eng{spirits must have been at work in performing this marvel} I aduBxtavanenxsaguvalilx alwkika vayxkitxgaLeV toDagididxrabeVku. \eng{haunted by spirits} pishAcagarxsatx. 
\num{6} kecucx; kalitana; dheYyaR; dhiVra parxvaqtitx; satatxvX: \eng{a man of unbending spirit} yArigU maNiyada dhiVra. \eng{if you had the spirit of a mouse, you would not have quailed like this} ninanxlilx oMdu iliyalilxruvaSATxdarU kecicxdidxdadxre hiVge niVnu gaDagaDa naDugutitxralilalx. 
\num{7} hurupu; humamxsusx; ceYtanayx; dheYyoRVtAsxha: \eng{Napoleon infused spirit into his men} nepoVliyananxnu tananx BaTaralilx dheYyoRVtAsxhavanunx tuMbautitxdadx. 
\num{8} (yAvudaradeV) jiVva; jiVvALa; ceYtanayx; AtamxsavxrUpa; pArxNapArxya; aMtaHsUPxtiR; perxVrakashakitx : \eng{he was the animating spirit of the revolution} avanu A kArxMtiya ceYtanayxveV Agidadx. 
\numi{9} 
\banum
\alnum{a} savxBAva; shiVla; parxkaqti; (vayxkitxya) mAnasika yA neYtika -- savxBAva yA guNa: \eng{a man of unbending spirit} bagagxda savxBAvada vayxkitx. 
\alnum{b} avugaLiMda kUDida vayxkitx: \eng{is an ardent spirit} humamxsusxLaLx, utAsxhi vayxkitx. 
\alnum{c} aMtarAtamx; aMtaHparxvaqtitx; oLa olavu: \eng{the spirit moves a person} vayxkitxyanunx avana aMtarAtamx perxVrisutatxde. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{10} parxvaqtitx; manoVvaqtitx; manoVdhamaR; daqSiTx: \eng{he took it in the right spirit} avanu adanunx sariyAda daqSiTxyalilx aMgiVkarisida. \eng{a spirit of mischief} keVDiga parxvaqtitx. \eng{you must enter into the spirit of a thing} niVnu adara manoVdhamaRvanunx aritukoLaLxbeVku, adara manoVdhamaRkekx hoMdikoLaLxbeVku. 
\num{11} manoVBAva; Ashaya; aMtarAthaR; nijavAda aBipArxya; iMgita: \eng{took it in the wrong spirit} adara tapupx athaRdalilx garxhisida. \eng{consider the spirit of the law, not the letter} shAsanada, kAnUnina iMgitavanunx parigaNisu, akaSxravananxlalx (shabadxgaLananxlalx). 
\num{12} (kAla, yuga, \mo vugaLa) parxvaqtitx; savxBAva; dhamaR: \eng{one cannot resist the spirit of the age} yAreV Agali yugadhamaRvanunx taDeyalu sAdhayxvilalx. 
\num{13} (\pArxparx) (ceVtana parxpaMcada vidayxmAnagaLanunx niyaMtirxsuva shakitxyeMdu hiMde BAvisidadx) apArxkaqta shakitx: \eng{animal spirits} sahajoVtAsxha; huTuTxhumamxsusx; huTiTxniMdaleV baMda, sAvxBAvikavAda utAsxha, humamxsusx. 
\num{14} sipxriTuTx; Asavisi tegeda bASapxshiVla darxva; madayxsAra. 
\num{15} shudidhxVkarisida AlokxVhAlf. 
\num{16} (\sA\ \bava dalilx) tiVkaSx NxvAda madayx, \kanmu\ AlokxhAlf, \udA, bArxMdi, visikx, jinf, ramf: \eng{a glass of spirits and water} oMdu loVTa jalamishirxta tiVkaSx Nx madayx. \eng{he touches no spirits but gin} avanu jinf oMdu horatu beVrAva tiVkaSx Nx madayxvanUnx muTuTxvudilalx. 
\num{17} sipxriTuTx; madAyxkaR; TiMkacxru; AlokxhAlinalilx viliVnagoLisida bASapxshiVla darxva. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{captious spirit} raMdhArxnevxVSaka, CidArxnevxVSaka, tapapxnenxV huDukuva -- manoVvaqtitx. 
\num{2} \eng{high} (\engit{or} \eng{great) spirits} gelavu; humamxsusx; ulAlxsa; lavalavike. 
\num{3}\eng{in} (\engit{or} \eng{in the) spirit} aMtamuRKiyAgi. 
\num{4} \hyperref{kandict_k.pdf}{K}{kindred(2) pagu}{$^2$kindred} \eng{spirit.} 
\num{5} \eng{poor} \engit{or} \eng{low spirits} nirutAsxha; maMku; viSAda; Kinanxte; kugugx.

\numi{2} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (savxlapxkAla, tAtAkxlikavAgi obabxnoDane yA oMdeDeyalilx BeVTikAranAgi) iru; taMgiru: \eng{stay at a hotel} oMdu hoVTelinalilx taMgiru. \eng{stay in a town} oMdu Urinalilx taMgiru. \eng{stay with person} obabxnoDane, obabxna maneyalilx taMgiru. \eng{stayed with them for Christmas} kirxsfmasf hababxdalilx avaroDane taMgidadxnu. 
\alnum{b} (sAkxTelxMDf matutx \da\ AphirXka \parx) kAyaM Agi vAsisu; shAshavxtavAgi nelasu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} (\pArxparx\ yA sAhitayxka) (naDeyutitxruvAga, EnanenxV mADutitxruvAga, mAtanADutitxruvAga, \kanmu\ vidhayxthaRdalilx) tALu; nilulx; taDe; iru: \eng{stay}! \eng{you forget one thing} tALu! niVnu oMdu viSaya maretididxVye. 
\num{4} (oMdu caTuvaTike yA kAyaR \mo valilx BAgavahisalu, pAlugoLaLxlu) sAkaSuTx kAla -- kAdiru, kAyu, iru, tALu, uLiduko: \eng{stay to supper} rAtirx UTakekx uLiduko. \eng{stay for the film} sinimAkAkxgi kAdiru.

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{has come} (\engit{or} \eng{is here) to stay} (\AmA) taLavUribiTaTxde; beVrUribiTiTxde; kAyaM eMdeV parigaNisabeVku.

\banum
\alnum{a} maneyalilx yA maneyoLageV iru; maneyiMda horage yA horakekx hoVgade iru. 
\alnum{b} (\kanmu\ shikeSxyAgi) (shAleyu mugida meVlU) shAleyalelxV yA shAleya koThaDiyalelxV iru. 
\eanum

\num{5} \eng{stay put} (\AmA) (vasutx yA vayxkitxya \vi) idadxlilxyeV, irisidalilxyeV, iTaTxlilxyeV -- iru. \eng{it will not stay put} adu iTaTx kaDe iruvudeV ilalx.

\bentry
\word[step(1)]{step} 
\pron{seTxpf}
\gl{\kirx}
\expl{(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{stepped;} \vakaq\ \eng{stepping}). }


\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} natiRsu; nataRna, naqtayx mADu. 
\num{2} (\nw) kUveyanunx (adara kuLiyalilx yA adara veVdikeya meVle) BadarxvAgi nililxsu. 
\num{3} hejejx hAki (dUra) aLe. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} hejejx -- hAku, iDu; aDiyiDu; kAlu hAku. 
\num{2} (nidiRSaTx dikikxnalilx) sari; jarugu; calisu; naDe; bA yA hoVgu: \eng{step aside} pakakxkekx, otatxTiTxge sari. \eng{step back} (oMdu hejejx) hiMdakekx hoVgu. \eng{step forward} muMdakekx bA; munanxDiyiDu. \eng{step across the road} rasetxya A kaDege hejejx hAku. \eng{step into the boat} doVNiyoLakekx -- kAliDu, aDiyiDu, parxveVshisu. 
\num{3} (nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx) hejejx hAku; kAliDu; muMduvari; ELige hoMdu: \eng{stepped into a new job} hosa kelasakekx kAliTaTx. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{step down} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (unanxta) sAthxna \mo vugaLiMda -- iLi; (avanunx) tayxjisu; (avakekx) rAjiVnAme koDu. 
\alnum{b} (\viduyx) voVleTxVjanunx -- iLisu, tagigxsu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{step high} (\kanmu\ kukokxVTada kudureya \vi) kAlaDigaLanunx etatxretatxrakekx etitx ODu. 
\numi{3} \eng{step in} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (mane, koThaDi, \mo vugaLa) oLakekx bA yA hoVgu; parxveVshisu; oLahogu. 
\alnum{b} (sahoVdoyxVgi \mo varige) badaliyAgi kelasa mADu; parxtiyAgi kelasa nivaRhisu. 
\alnum{c} (yAvudeV kelasakekx neravAgalu yA aDiDxpaDisalu) naDuve baru; madhayxparxveVsha mADu; kAlu -- hAku, koDu, tUrisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{4} \eng{step into the breach} (raNaraMgadalilx maDida yoVdhana) KAli sAthxnavanunx tuMbau, vahisiko; terapAda sAthxnakekx baMdu kAyaR nivaRhisu. 
\num{5} \eng{step into fortune} adaqSaTxkekx kAliDu; adaqSaTx paDe. 
\num{6} \eng{step it} natiRsu; naqtayx mADu. 
\num{7} \eng{step on it (or on the} \hyperref{kandict_g.pdf}{G}{gas(1) nuga}{$^1$gas}). 
\numi{8} \eng{step out} 
\banum
\alnum{a} doDaDx yA ududxdadxvAda hejejx hAku. 
\alnum{b} (mane, koThaDi, \mo\ jAgadiMda) horahoraDu; biTuTx horaDu. 
\alnum{c} sAmAjika caTuvaTikegaLalilx -- BAgavahisu, sakirxya pAtarxvahisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{9} \eng{step short} kiru, saNaNx hejejx -- iDu, hAku. 
\hyperdef{S}{step(1) pagu(10)}{} 
\num{10} \eng{step this way} (gaNayxvayxkitxyanunx gwravadiMda sAvxgatisuvalilx) itatx dayemADi, pAdabeLesi; hiVge dayemADi, baninx. 
\num{11} \eng{step through a dance} (yAvudeV naqtayxda) naDege, layakekx, takakxMte -- kAlu hAku, aDigaLaninxDu. 
\numi{12} \eng{step up} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (dara, veVga, \mo vanunx) Erisu; hecicxsu; tiVvarxgoLisu. 
\alnum{b} (\viduyx) (TArxnfsxphAmaRrf baLasi) voVleTxVjf -- hecicxsu, Erisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\bentry
\word[step(2)]{step} 
\pron{seTxpf}
\gl{\nA}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (naDage, OTa, kuNita, ivugaLalilx omemx iDuva) hejejx; aDi: \eng{he took a step back} avanu oMdu hejejx -- hiMdiTaTx , hiMdakekx sarida. 
\num{2} oMdu hejejx (dUra): \eng{he took a long step towards success} avanu geluvinatatx dApugAlu hAkida, doDaDx hejejx iTaTx. \eng{do not move a step}! oMdu hejejx (muMde) iTiTxVye, joVke! 
\num{3} oMdeV hejejx; tiVra kaDime dUra: \eng{it is but a step from my door} nananx maneyiMda adu, oMdeV hejejx (dUradalilxde). 
\num{4} hejejx; aDi; hejejxya gurutu. 
\num{5} hejejx(ya sadudx): \eng{do you hear a step ?} ninage hejejxya sadudx keVLisutitxdeyeV? 
\num{6} (kaNiNxMda kaMDa yA kiviyiMda keVLida (vayxkitxya) naDe; naDage; hejejx; hejejx iDuva riVti, vidhAna: \eng{I recognized her step} nAnu Akeya hejejxyanunx gurutiside. \eng{he walks with a rapid step} avanu veVgavAgi hejejx hAkutAtxne. 
\numi{7} sari hejejx; sama hejejx : 
\banum
\alnum{a} hejejxge hejejx hAkuvudu; kAlakekx sariyAgi yA tALakekx sariyAgi itararoMdige hejejx hAkuvudu: \eng{in step} samavAgi hejejx hAkutatx. \eng{out of step} tapupx hejejx hAkutatx. 
\alnum{b} (kelasa kAyaRgaLalilx) itararoMdige sarisamanAgi, hoMdAvaNeyiMda, hoMdANikeyiMda, sarihoMduvaMte iruvudu: \eng{in step} sari hoMdAvaNeyiMda. \eng{out of step} hoMdANikeyilalxde. \eng{refuses to keep step with the team} taMDadoMdige hoMdikoLaLxlu, hejejx hAkalu nirAkarisutAtxne. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} (yAvudeV kAyaRvidhAnadalilx) iTaTx oMdu hejejx; tegedukoMDa oMdu karxma: \eng{I must take steps in the matter} I viSayadalilx nAnu sUkatx karxmagaLanunx tegedukoLaLxbeVku. \eng{we must take steps to prevent the danger} I apAya tapipxsalu (takakx) karxmagaLanunx nAvu tegedukoLaLxbeVku. \eng{a rash step} duDukina hejejx, karxma. \eng{a prudent step} viveVkada -- karxma, hejejx. 
\num{9} (mahaDiyanunx, vAhanavanunx, ENiyanunx hatatxlu yA iLiyalu baLasuva, maneya bAgilu, veVdike, \mo vugaLa muMdiruva) meTiTxlu; haMta; pAvaTige; soVpAna. 
\num{10} (himAvaqtavAda kaDibaMDeyanenxVruva pavaRtAroVhiyu himarAshiyalelxV katatxrisi koMDa) kacucx; haMta; hejejx. 
\numi{11} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (baDati yA Adayxteya sherxVNiyalilxna) sAthxna; dajeR; aMtasutx; haMta. 
\alnum{b} (veVtanasherxVNiyalilxna) nidiRSaTx haMtagaLalilx, GaTaTxgaLalilx oMdu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{12} (\bava dalilx) = \hyperlink{stepladder}{stepladder}. 
\num{13} (\saM) (\kanmu\ \ame) savxrAvadhi; oMdu savxrakUkx meVlina savxrakUkx naDuvaNa aMtara. 
\num{14} (\nw) (kUveyanunx nililxsuva) kuLi; piVTha; jaguli. 
\num{15} (baDagigelasadalilx) laMbAkArada halage, paTiTx, \mo vanunx bigiyAgi naDuve joVDisiruva marada dimimx yA doDaDx halage. 
\num{16} (yaMtarxgaLalilx) koLaveya keLaBAgada kuLi, gUDu). 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{break step} hejejx tapupx; (itarara hejejxge sariyAgi hoMdikoLaLxde) tapupx hejejx hAku. 
\num{2} \eng{change step} hejejx badalAyisu; aduvarege iDutitxdadx hejejxya karxmavanunx badalAyisu. 
\num{3} \eng{in a person's steps} (vayxkitxya) hejejxyanunx, meVlapxMkitxyanunx, udAharaNeyanunx -- anusarisi. 
\num{4} \eng{keep step} (itararige samavAgi yA tALa \mo vakekx sariyAgi) sari hejejx hAku. 
\num{5} \eng{mind} (\engit{or} \eng{watch) one's step} huSAru! joVke! ecacxradiMdiru! jAgarUkanAgiru! 
\num{6} \eng{pair of steps} (\Eva) = \hyperlink{stepladder}{stepladder}. 
\numi{7} \eng{step by step} 
\banum
\alnum{a} hejejx hejejxyAgi; oMdAda meVloMdaraMte. 
\alnum{b} (\rUpa) haMta haMtavAgi; karxmeVNa; karxmashaH; karxmakarxmavAgi. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{turn one's steps} oMdu gotAtxda dikikxge tirugu; nidiRSaTx, gotAtxda dikikxnalilx -- naDe. 
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\pron{siTxkf}

\expl{(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{stuck} \ucAcx-- saTxkf). }


\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (vasutx yA adara tudiyanunx) cucucx; oLahoVgisu; tUrisu: \eng{stuck a finger in my eye} nananx kaNiNxna oLakekx beraLu cucicxda. \eng{stick the bayonet through the breast} edeyoLakekx saniVnu hogisu, tUrisu. \eng{stick a pin through it} adaroLakekx guMDusUji cucucx. 
\num{2} (monacu tudiyiMda) cucucx; iri; tivi: \eng{I will pull out my knife and stick you} nananx cAku hiridu ninanxnunx iriyutetxVne. \eng{stick the spurs in the horse's sides} rikApina moneyiMda kudureya pakekxgaLanunx tivi. 
\num{3} (moneyanunx) nATu; neDu; cucucx : \eng{cake stuck (over) with almonds} bAdAmi biVja nATida keVku. \eng{pin cushion stuck full of pins} tuMba guMDusUji cucicxda sUjimetetx. 
\num{4} (salAki \mo vugaLa moneya meVle yA moneya meVle heVgoV hAge) cucicxDu; sikikxsu; sikikxsiDu; neDu; nATisu (\akirx\ saha): \eng{the heads of the beheaded were stuck on the spikes of the gateway} diDiDx bAgilina salAkigaLa monegaLa meVle shiraceCxVda hoMdidavara talegaLanunx sikikxsalAgitutx. \eng{the arrows stuck in the target} A bANagaLu gurihalageyalilx nATikoMDuvu. \eng{a piece of needlework with the needle stuck in it} sUjiyanunx sikikxsida kasUti baTeTx. \eng{stick the feather in your cap} A gariyanunx ninanx ToVpige sikikxsiko. \eng{stick the rose in the buttonhole} guMDiya tUtige gulAbi hUvanunx sikikxsiko. \eng{stick pen behind one's ear} kiviya hiMde penanxnunx sikikxsiko. 
\num{5} (\kanmu\ avasaradalilx) aDADxdiDiDxyAgi hAku; alilx ililx iDu: \eng{stick a few commas in it} kelavu alapx virAma cihenxgaLanunx alalxlilx hAku, seVrisu. \eng{just stick it on the table}, (\engit{or} \eng{down anywhere)} idanunx sumamxne meVjina meVle (yA elolxV oMdu kaDe) iDu, hAku: \eng{stick your cap on} ninanx ToVpiyanunx taleya meVle hAkiko, iTuTxko. \eng{stick them in your pocket} avugaLanunx ninanx jeVbinalilxTuTxko. 
\num{6} (aMTu \mo vugaLiMda) aMTisu; hatitxsu; hacucx; kacicxsu: \eng{stick label} leVbalalxnunx, ciVTiyanunx -- aMTisu, hacucx. \eng{stick a postage stamp} aMceya sATxMpanunx aMTisu, hacucx. \eng{stick it on the bill} Bititxpatarxda meVle adanunx aMTisu. 
\num{7} (\AmA) tALiko; taDeduko; sahisu; sahisiko: \eng{I cannot stick that worthless fellow} A ayoVgayxnanunx nAnu sahisalAre. \eng{I couldn't stick it any longer} inunx (muMde) adanunx taDedukoLaLxlu, sahisikoMDiralu, nanage sAdhayxvilalx. 
\num{8} (vayxkitxya meVle yAvudakekxV Agali) doVSAroVpaNe mADu; tapupx horisu. 
\num{9} (giDakekx, baLiLxge UreyAgi) koVlanunx -- kaTuTx, neDu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent 
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} aMTiko; kacicxko; hatitxko:\eng{this envelope will not stick} I lakoVTeyu aMTikoLuLxvudilalx. \eng{sticks like a bur} aMTupuraLeyaMte aMTikoLuLxtatxde.

\bentry
\word[stone(1)]{stone} 
\pron{soTxVnf}

\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} 
\banum
\alnum{a} kalulx; ashamx; pASANa; shile: \eng{built of great stones} BAri kalulxgaLiMda kaTiTxda; BAri BAri shilegaLiMda nimiRsida. \eng{as hard as a stone} kalilxnaSuTx gaTiTxyAda. 
\alnum{b} kalilxna saNaNx cUru; saNaNx kalulx (\kanmu\ saNaNx saNaNx goVli kalulx). 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} (\Kani) parxshasatx shile; ratanx; kalulx; haraLu; maNi: \eng{no stone in it worth less than Rs.1,000/-} oMdu sAvira rUpAyigaLigiMta kaDime bALuva kalulx , ratanx adaralilxlalx. 
\num{3} kalulx; shile; kalilxna rUpada darxvayx, sAmagirx, \udA, \eng{limestone.} 
\numi{4} kaTaTxDada (kelasada) kalulx jAtigaLu: 
\banum
\alnum{a} = \hyperref{kandict_l.pdf}{L}{limestone}{limestone} \eng{(Portland stone)} 
\alnum{b} = \hyperlink{sandstone}{sandstone} \eng{(Bath stone).} 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} (halavomemx \saMpa gaLalilx baLake) hesarisida yAvudeV nidiRSaTx AkAradalilx yA nidiRSaTx udedxVshakekx rUpisida kalulx, shile: \eng{tombstone} samAdhishile. \eng{stepping-stone} meTiTxlugalulx. 
\num{6} (mudarxNa) mudarxNPalaka; puTagaLa meVle acucxmADalu baLasuva samatalavAda capapxTe halage, Palaka. 
\num{7} kAThinayxdalilx yA AkAradalilx kalalxnunx hoVluva vasutx, \udA\ haNiNxna OTe, goraTe, goTeTx, biVja, \mo vu. 
\numi{8} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (\roVshA) (aneVka veVLe \bava dalilx \parx) (roVgada cihenxyAgi deVhadalilxruva) gaTiTxyAda dumARMsa. 
\alnum{b} (\kanmu) ashamxri; mUtarxkoVsha, pitatxkoVshagaLalilxna kalulx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{9} (\pArxparx\ yA \ashi) taruDu; vaqSaNa. 
\num{10} (\bava\ adeV) (\birx) (manuSayx yA pArxNiyanunx tUka mADuvalilx baLasuva) \eng{14} pwMDu (yA \eng{6.35}ke.ji.) tUkada mUlamAna. 
\num{11} = \hyperref{kandict_m.pdf}{M}{meteoric stone}{meteoric stone}. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{a stone's throw} kalelxseyuvaSuTx, kalelxsetada dUra; tiVra hatitxra; aSeTxVnU dUravalalx. 
\numi{2} \eng{break stones} 
\banum
\alnum{a} jalilx oDe. 
\alnum{b} jalilx oDedu hoTeTx hore, jiVvikeyanunx gaLisiko. 
\alnum{c} daTaTx daridArxvasethx talupu; tiVra baDatanakekx biVLu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{3} \eng{cast} (\engit{or} \eng{throw) stones} \engit{or} \eng{a stone at}, \engit{or} \eng{the first stone} 
\banum
\alnum{a} kalulx biVru; kalelxse. 
\alnum{b} kalelxse; (yAvudeV vayxkitxya naDateyanunx) dUSisu, niMdisu, dUru; yAvudeV vayxkitxya (\kanmu\ shiVlada) meVle apavAda, AroVpa, apaKAyxti -- horisu; doVSAroVpaNe mADu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{4} \eng{give a stone and a beating to} (modalige kudure paMdayxda \ashi) sulaBavAgi (itararanunx) miVrisu; itararigiMta migilAgu; itararanunx soVlisu. 
\num{5} \eng{give a stone for bread} roTiTxyanunx beVDidare kalulx koDu; (kelasakekx bAradadxnunx koTuTx) (BAriV) neravu niVDidaMte naTisu, sahAyada aNakavADu. 
\numi{6} \eng{harden into stone} 
\banum
\alnum{a} kalAlxgu; shileyAgu; gaTiTxyAgu; GaniVkarisu. 
\alnum{b} kalAlxgu; jaDavAgi hoVgu; ceYtanayx kaLeduko; aceVtanadaMtAgi hoVgu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{7} \eng{have a heart of stone} kalelxde, kalulx haqdaya -- hoMdiru; pASANahaqdayadavanAgiru; dayAdAkiSxNayxvilalxdava nAgiru; manuSayxtavxvilalxdavanAgiru; kaThinahaqdayanAgiru: \eng{he has a heart of stone} avanadu kaThina, kalulx -- haqdaya. 
\num{8} \eng{kill two} \hyperref{kandict_b.pdf}{B}{bird(1) nuga(9)}{$^1$birds} \eng{with one stone}. 
\num{9} \hyperref{kandict_l.pdf}{L}{leave(1) nuga(15)}{$^1$leave} \eng{no stone unturned.} 
\num{10}\eng{mark with a white stone} (pArxciVna roVmanaru paMcAMgadalilx utasxvada, hababxda dinagaLanunx siVmesuNaNxdiMda gurutisutitxdudxdariMda) utasxvada, saMtoVSada dinaveMdu samxrisu yA barediDu. 
\num{11} \eng{stones will cry out} (ayoyxV, anAyxya anAyxya eMdu) kalulxgaLU kUgi heVLutatxve; (BAri anAyxyavanunx tALalArade) aceVtanagaLU, nijiRVva vasutxgaLU saha hAhAkAra mADutatxve. 
\num{12} \eng{those who live in glasshouses should not throw stones} gAjina maneyalilxruvavaru itarara maneya meVle kalelxseyabAradu; tamamxlelxV huLukiruvavaru itarara huLuketitx ADabAradu.

\pron{sATxpf}

\expl{(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{stopped}; \vakaq\ \eng{stopping}). }


\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (beNe, biraDe, \mo vanunx hAki yA baTeTx \mo vanunx turuki kaMDi, biruku, \mo vanunx) mucucx; mucicx hAku; baMdhisu; baMdu mADu: \eng{stop a leak} (kaMDiyanunx, birukanunx) mucucx; niVru \mo vu oLakekx nugugxvudanunx yA horakekx soVruvudanunx taDe, tapipxsu. 
\num{2} (shurxtiyanunx, oMdu sAthxyiyaSuTx keLakikxLisalu, tagigxsalu) AgaRnf vAdayxda meVlutxdiyanunx mucucx. 
\num{3} (birxDfjx isipxVTATa) edurALigaLanunx taDe; avaru elalx varisegaLanUnx paDedukoLuLxvudanunx tapipxsu. 
\num{4} (\birx) (cinanx, beLiLx matutx pAdarasagaLa puDi yA simeMTf, \mo vugaLiMda) huLuku halalxnunx, halilxna kuLiyanunx tuMbau; ToLuLx halalxnunx BatiR mADu. 
\numi{5} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (calane \mo vanunx) taDe; parxtibaMdhisu; niroVdhisu; muMduvareyadaMte nililxsu. 
\alnum{b} (yAvudaradeV parxgati, calane yA kirxyeyanunx) saMpUNaRvAgi taDe; sathxgitagoLisu. 
\alnum{c} samapaRkavAgi -- aDiDxpaDisu, taDe; mADadaMte, nililxsuvaMte mADu: \eng{stopped them playing cricket} avaru kirxkeTf ADuvudanunx taDeda, ADadaMte mADida. 
\alnum{d} (kAyaR yA kirxyegaLa saraNiyanunx) nililxsu; muMduvaresadiru: \eng{stop subscribing} caMdA (koDuvudanunx) nililxsu. \eng{will stop my visits} nananx BeVTigaLanunx nililxsutetxVne. 
\alnum{e} taDe; aDaDxgaTuTx; tapipxsu: \eng{stop the ball from going to the boundary} ceMDu bwMDarige hoVguvudanunx -- taDe, tapipxsu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{6} (muSiTxyudadhx) 
\banum
\alnum{a} (edurALiya) peTaTxnunx taDe, nivArisu, tapipxsiko. 
\alnum{b} edurALiyanunx (AKeYrAgi) soVlisu; hoDeduruLisu; hoDedu keDavu; matetx hoVrATakikxLiyadaMte mADu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{7} (\ashi) (ETu \mo vanunx) tinunx; tinunxtitxru; edurALige parxti ETu hoDeyalArade yA edurALiya ETanunx tapipxsikoLaLxlArade hoVgu. 
\num{8} sadudx keVLadaMte mADu; sadudx keVLibaradaMte (kada hAkuvudu \mo vanunx) mADu. 
\num{9} (\toV) giDavanunx civuTi hiDidu (modalidadxMte) neTaTxge nililxsu. 
\num{10} (gaDiyAravanunx, kAKARne \mo vanunx) nililxsu; naDeyadaMte, kelasa mADadaMte -- mADu. 
\num{11} (mAmUlAgi koDutitxruvudanunx yA anumati koDuvudanunx) nililxsu; sathxgitagoLisu; taDe hiDi: \eng{I shall stop your wages} nAnu ninanx saMbaLavanunx, veVtanavanunx, nililxsibiDutetxVne. \eng{I shall stop your meetings} ninanx kUTagaLanunx nAnu nililxsibiDutetxVne. 
\num{12} (piTiVlu \mo vugaLa taMtiyanunx) nidiRSaTx sAthxnadalilx beraLiniMda otitx hiDidu apeVkiSxta shurxtige Erisu yA iLisu. 
\num{13} virAma cihenxgaLanunx (vAkayxdalilx) hAku, seVrisu: \eng{a badly spelt and stopped letter} tapupx kAguNita, tapupx virAma cihenxgaLiMda kUDida kAgada. 
\numi{14} (\nw) 
\banum
\alnum{a} (horaji \mo vanunx) taDe kaTiTxniMda bigi(du kaTuTx). 
\alnum{b} baMdhisu; haDaganunx laMgaru hAki nililxsu. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} nilulx; niMtuhoVgu; aMtayxvAgu; konegANu: \eng{the noise stopped} A gadadxla konegoMDitu. \eng{the} \eng{annuity stopped} A vaSARshanavu niMtuhoVyitu, barutitxdudxdu tapipxhoVyitu. \eng{supplies suddenly stopped} sarabarAjugaLu idadxkikxdadxMte niMtuhoVdavu. 
\num{2} (naDe, calana yA ADutitxdadx mAtu yA mADutitxdadx kelasa) nilulx; niMtubiDu; sathxgitavAgu: \eng{the car stopped outside the house} A kAru maneya horagaDe niMtitu. \eng{he stopped in the middle of a sentence} oMdu vAkayxda madhayxdalilx avana mAtu niMtubiTiTxtu, avanu tananx mAtanunx nililxsibiTaTx. \eng{my watch has stopped} nananx gaDiyAra niMtuhoVgide. \eng{this train does not stop at} (\engit{or} \eng{before) Kengeri} I reYlu keMgeVriyalilx (keMgeVri nilAdxNada muMde) nilulxvudilalx. \eng{he never stops to think} avanu yoVcisalu kAyuvudeV ilalx, taDeyuvudeV ilalx. 
\num{3} (\AmA) iru; kAdiru; taMgiru; uLi; taMgu; savxlapx hotutx, kelavu divasa -- uLiduko: \eng{I shall stop in bed a bit longer} nAnu inUnx savxlapx hotutx hAsigeyalelxV irutetxVne. \eng{I have been stopping in Bangalore with friends} nAnu beMgaLUrinalilx senxVhitaroDane taMgidedxVne. \eng{are you going to stop for the sermon} upadeVsha BASaNavanunx keVLalu niVnu kAdiruveyA? 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum

\noindent

\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} tagulisu; tAku; tAkisu; hoDe; hoDeyisu: \eng{struck by lightning, he dropped dead} siDilu hoDedu yA taguli avanu satutxbidadx. \eng{I struck my foot against a stone} nAnu nananx kAlanunx oMdu kalilxge taguliside, tAkiside, kalalxnunx eDavide. 
\num{2} hoDe; baDi; peTuTx hAku; ETu koDu; bArisu: \eng{he struck me in the mouth with his fist} avanu nananx bAyiya meVle muSiTxyiMda hoDeda. \eng{he struck his hand on the table} avanu meVjina meVle tananx keYyanunx baDida. 
\num{3} apapxLisu; Dikikx hoDe; balavAgi tAku; saMGaTiTxsu: \eng{the ship struck a rock} haDagu baMDege baDiyitu, apapxLisitu. 
\num{4} hoDedu dUrakekx -- ese, bisADu, nUku, dUDu: \eng{strike the ball out of court} ceMDanunx koVTiRniMda, kirxVDAMgaNadiMda Acege hoVguvaMte hoDe. 
\num{5} (kokekxyu miVnige balavAgi cucicxkoLuLxvaMte) gALada huriyanunx sarakakxne ADisu, eLe (\akirx\ saha). 
\num{6} (hAdi \mo vanunx) kaMDuhiDi; patetx hacucx. 
\num{7} (viraLavAda, apUvaRvAda vasutx \mo vugaLanunx) saMdhisu; kaMDuko; edurAgu. 
\num{8} bAvi agedu, koredu (peTorxVliyaM \mo vanunx) paDe, kaMDuhiDi. 
\num{9} aBivaqdidhx yA jaya paDe; ucACx rxya sithxtige baru. 
\num{10} (hAvina \vi) koVrehalilxniMda kacucx. 
\numi{11} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (beMkikaDiDxyanunx) giVri hotitxsu. 
\alnum{b} (kaDiDx , kalulx , \mo vanunx) ujijx kiDi -- horaDisu, hotitxsu, uMTumADu, barisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{12} (gaDiyArada \vi) gaMTe hoDedu kAlavanunx sUcisu: \eng{the clock strikes ten} gaDiyAra hatutx gaMTe hoDeyutatxde. 
\num{13} baDidu, miDidu, miVTi -- (saMgiVtada) savxra, nAda, shabadx horaDisu. 
\num{14} (nANayxvanunx) TaMkisu; mudirxsu; CApu mADu. 
\num{15} opapxMda, oDaMbaDike -- mADiko; gotitxge baru. 
\num{16} EkAEki, idadxkikxdadxMte, taTakakxne, haThAtAtxgi -- AguvaMte mADu: \eng{was struck dumb} idadxkikxdadxMte mUkanAda, mAtu nilulxvaMtAda. 
\num{17} manasisxge toVru, kANu, tAku, eninxsu, aninxsu, suPxrisu, hoLe; gamanakekx baru; gamana seLe: \eng{what struck me was the generosity of the offer} A vAgAdxna yA koDuge eSuTx udAravAdadudx eMdu nanaganinxsitu. \eng{it struck my eye as I glanced over the letter} A kAgadada meVle kaNuNx hAyisidAga adu nananx kaNaNxnunx seLeyitu. \eng{it strikes me that he may have misunderstood} avanu tapupx tiLidukoMDirabahudeMdu nanage toVrutitxde. \eng{an idea suddenly struck me} oMdu BAvane nanage taTakakxne hoLeyitu. \eng{it strikes me as ridiculous} adu shudadhx hAsAyxsapxdavAgi, asaMbadadhxveMdu nanage kANisutitxde. 
\num{18} (bAvuTa, haDagina hAyi, guDAra, \mo vanunx) iLisu, kaLacu yA tegeduhAku. 
\num{19} (\ame) mAliVkana virudadhx muSakxra hUDu. 
\num{20} (camaR \mo\ horahodike \mo vugaLa mUlaka) oLa -- hoVgisu, hoVgu; oLakekx -- iLisu, iLi; tUrisu; nATisu; nATu; BeVdisikoMDu, koredukoMDu -- parxveVshisu: \eng{he struck a knife into the enemy's heart} avanu shaturxvina edege cUriyanunx nATida: \eng{he struck terror into every heart} avanu parxtiyobabxra haqdayadalUlx BiVtiyanunx huTiTxsida. \eng{in printing, ink strikes through paper} mudarxNadalilx, masiyu kAgadada mUlaka oLakikxLiyutatxde. \eng{cold struck through his dress into the marrow} caLi avana baTeTxyanunx BeVdisikoMDu avana mULege tagulitu. \eng{the sun's rays strike through fog} sUyaRna kiraNagaLu daTaTxvAda maMjanunx BeVdisikoMDu barutatxve. \eng{the plant strikes its roots into the soil} giDavu beVrugaLanunx maNiNxnoLakekx, neladoLakekx iLisutatxde. 
\num{21} EkAEki, haThAtf, idadxkikxdadxMte -- eragu, meVle biVLu, AkarxmaNa mADu: \eng{he was struck with sudden terror} haThAtf BiVti avana meVlerigitu. 
\num{22} (giDada kasikoMbeyanunx) neDu; neladalilx hULu. 
\num{23} (giDa yA kasikoMbe \mo vugaLa \vi) beVru biDu (\akirx\ saha): \eng{the plant strikes root} giDavu beVru biDutatxde. 
\num{24} (roVgada \vi) aMTu; hatutx; hiDi; tagulu. 
\num{25} (dhAnayx \mo vanunx tuMbi aLeyuva aLatesAdhanadalilx aLeyutitxruva vasutxvanunx) tuMbi tale -- hoDe, savaru. 
\num{26} talupu yA sAdhisu: \eng{strike a balance} (eraDu virudadhx niluvu, pakaSxgaLu, \mo vugaLa naDuve) samatoVla sAdhisu; rAjige baru. 
\num{27} jamA KacuRgaLanunx parishiVlisi -- shilukx toVrisu; uLike, sheVSa nidhaRrisu. 
\num{28} (elAlx bAbaugaLanunx samiVkarisi) sarAsari kaMDuhiDi. 
\num{29} (\kanmu\ oMdu pakaSxvu nirAkarisuvaSuTx janara saMKeyxyaSaTxnenxV adara parxtipakaSxkUkx nirAkarisuva avakAsha niVDi) uBayasamamxtavAda nAyxyadashiR maMDali racisu. 
\num{30} (idadxkikxdadxMte matutx nATakiVyavAgi) deVhada BaMgiyanunx yA manoVBAvavanunx -- taLe, tALu, hoMdu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent 
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} 
\banum
\alnum{a} hoDe; saMGaTiTxsu; balavAgi tagulu, tAku, baDi: \eng{lightning never strikes twice in the same place} siDilu oMdeV jAgadalilx eraDu eraDu sala hoDeyuvudilalx, baDiyuvudilalx. \eng{the hammer strikes on the bell} A baDigeyu gaMTeya (meY) meVle baDiyutatxde. 
\alnum{b} hoDeyalu parxyatinxsu: \eng{strike at the goal} goVlige, goVlinatatx (ceMDanunx) hoDeyalu parxyatinxsu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{2} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (gaDiyArada \vi) gaMTe -- hoDe, bArisu: \eng{the clock strikes} gaDiyAra gaMTe bArisutatxde. 
\alnum{b} (kAlada \vi) gaMTe hoDedu sUcitavAgu, gotAtxgu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} bAvuTa iLisi sharaNAgatiyanunx sUcisu; sharaNAgu. 
\num{4} (nwkararu, kelasagArara \vi) saMpu, muSakxra -- hUDu; parxtiBaTaneyAgi kelasa (mADuvudanunx) nililxsu: \eng{strike for higher pay etc.,} (saMbaLa, veVtana, \mo vugaLa) hecacxLakAkxgi saMpu hUDu. 
\num{5} (siMpi maqdavxMgigaLa \vi) (hoLe \mo vugaLa) taLakekx -- aMTiko, kacicxko, hatitxko. 
\num{6} dAri hiDi; dikikxge tirugu yA dikikxnalilx hoVgu: \eng{strike east} pUvaRkekx tirugu; pUvaRdikikxge hoVgu. \eng{strike into a path} oMdu dAriyalilx, dAri, jADu, hiDidu hoVgu. \eng{strike out of a track} dAri, jADu biTuTx hoVgu. \eng{then strike to the left} AmeVle eDakekx tirugu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{how does it strike you?} ninage Enaninxsutatxde yA heVge toVrutitxde? (I bagegx) ninanx aBipArxyaveVnu?

\numie

\num{4} \eng{strike at} (yAranenxV, yAvudanenxV) hoDeyalu yatinxsu. 
\num{5} \eng{strike at the} \hyperref{kandict_r.pdf}{R}{root(1) pagu(7)}{$^1$root(s)} \eng{of.}

\num{9} \eng{strike hands} (\pArxparx) (keYgUDida opapxMda \mo vugaLa kuruhAgi) keY -- muTuTx, kuluku, hiDi, joVDisu. 
\numi{10} \eng{strike home} 
\banum

\alnum{b} guri -- sAdhisu, muTuTx, tAku; udedxVshisida pariNAma biVru: \eng{my words struck home} nananx mAtugaLu pariNAma biVridavu, guri muTiTxdavu.

\eanum
\numie
\num{12} \eng{strike into a subject} adhayxyanada, BASaNada, adhAyxpanada, viSayakekx baru, parxveVshisu.

\num{14} \eng{strike lucky} adaqSaTx baladiMda gelavu hoMdu, vijaya paDe. 
\num{15} \eng{strike me dead}! (\ashi, ANe iTuTxkoLuLxvalilx tananxnenxV shapisikoLuLxvAga) nanAnxNe! nananx jiVvada meVlANe! 
\num{16} \eng{strike me pink}! (\ashi) (aniriVkiSxta AshacxyaRvanunx sUcisuvalilx) elel! elA ninanx, ivana, itAyxdi. 
\numi{17} \eng{strike off} 
\banum

\alnum{b} (hesaru \mo vanunx, dAKale pusatxkadiMda) hoDedu hAku; tegedu hAku.

\bentry
\word[stroke(1)]{stroke} 
\pron{soTxrXVkf}
\gl{\nA}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} ETu; peTuTx; hoDeta; parxhAra: \eng{receive 20 strokes of the birch} bacfR CaDiyiMda 20 ETugaLanunx tinunx. \eng{with one stroke of his sword} tananx KaDagxda oMdeV ETiniMda. 
\num{2} haThAtAtxda parxbala hoDeta; dhakekx; AGAta: \eng{killed by a stroke of lightning} siDilina hoDetadiMda satatx. 
\num{3} (\kanmu\ miduLige rakatxda harivu niMtu Aguva) lakavx; pAshavxRvAyuvina hoDeta. 
\num{4} (punaH punaH naDeyuva oMdu kirxyeyalilx yA calaneyalilx) (yAvudanenxV mADalu) oMdu parxyatanx, paTuTx. 
\numi{5} 
\banum
\alnum{a} oMdu sututx. 
\alnum{b} oMdu sutitxna avadhi yA riVti. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} tusa, atayxlapx, eLaLxSuTx -- parxyatanx, kelasa: \eng{he hasn't done a stroke of work} avanu eLaLxSUTx parxyatanxvanunx, kelasavanunx -- mADilalx. 
\num{7} (rekekx, doVNiya huTuTx, \mo vugaLa) oMdu pUtiR -- biVsu, hoDeta. 
\num{8} (koMtada yA ADubeNeya yAvudeV kaDegina) eDeyATa; oMdu paTiTxna calane, sarita. 
\num{9} (gAlfphx) ceMDina (gelalxMkavAgi parigaNisuva) oMdu hoDeta yA biVsu. 
\numi{10} (doVNi naDesuvudaralilx) 
\banum
\alnum{a} huTuTx hAkuva riVti. 
\alnum{b} huTiTxna hoDeta: \eng{the second boat is gaining at every stroke} eraDaneya doVNiyu oMdoMdu hoDetakUkx veVga veVgavAgi sAgutitxde. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{11} (Ijinalilx) kAlu, toVLugaLa biVsu; kAlu, toVLugaLanunx biVsuva riVti. 
\num{12} (ATa \mo vugaLalilx, bAyxTu \mo vugaLiMda) hoDeyuva riVti; hoDetada -- paTuTx, varise: \eng{he invented a new stroke in cricket} kirxkeTfnalilx avanu oMdu hosabageya hoDetavanunx, variseyanunx saqSiTxsida. 
\num{13} kwshala; neYpuNayx; yashasivxyAda yA kushalavAda, nipuNavAda parxyatanx: \eng{a stroke of wit, diplomacy, etc.} hAsayx kwshala, rAjataMtarx neYpuNayx, \mo vu. 
\numi{14} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (penisxlulx, penunx, kuMca, \mo vugaLiMda eLeda) gere; reVKe: \eng{thick stroke} dapapx gere. \eng{thin stroke} sUkaSx mx reVKe. \eng{has dashed off the picture with a few strokes of the brush} kuMcada kelaveV geregaLiMda sararxne citarxvanunx baredu hAkida. 
\alnum{b} (mudarxNadalilxna) aMthadeV gere: \eng{oblique stroke} Ore gere. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{15} (vaNaRneyoMdaralilx oTaTxMdakekx kaLe taruva) yAvudeV vivara, aMsha: \eng{the description is full of strokes from the life} vaNaRne badukina vivaragaLiMda, vAsatxvAMshagaLiMda tuMbide. 
\num{16} gaDiyArada -- hoDeta, tADana; GaMTeya shabadx. 
\hypertarget{stroke(1)17}{} 
\numi{17} 
\banum
\alnum{a} hiMcUNi huTuTxgAra; kAlakekx sariyAgi huTuTx hAkuvaMte nideRVshisalu doVNiya himUmxtige atayxMta hatitxradalilx kULitu huTuTx hAkuvava. 
\alnum{b} hiMcUNi huTuTx; kAlakekx sariyAgi huTuTx hAkuvaMte nideRVshisuva, doVNiya himUmxtige atayxMta hatitxraviruva huTuTx. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{at a stroke} oMdeV ETige; oMdeV paTiTxge; Ekfdamf.

\num{2} (vasutxvanunx racisiruva, \kanmu\ GanamUla) vasutx; Bwtika padAthaR: \eng{a porous substance} raMdharxmaya padAthaR. \eng{a transparent substance} pAradashaRka vasutx. 
\num{3} EkarUpavAda guNagaLanunx hoMdiruva yAvudeV padAthaR; vasutx: \eng{this substance is salt} idu, I padAthaR -- upupx. \eng{metallic substance} loVhada vasutx. 
\num{4} vAsatxvavAdadudx; satayxvAdadudx; vasutxBUtavAdadudx: \eng{sacrifice the substance for the shadow} vAsatxvikavAdudanunx biTuTx neraLu hiDi. 
\num{5} satatxvX; huruLu; tiruLu: \eng{an argument of little substance} huruLilalxda vAda. 
\num{6} (sheYlige, rUpakekx BinanxvAgi vAda, kalAkaqti, \mo vugaLa) vasutx; viSaya: \eng{the substance is good, but the style is repellant} viSaya cenAnxgide, Adare sheYli asahayxvAgide. 
\num{7} mUla savxrUpa: \eng{the Son being of one substance with the Father} mUla savxrUpadalilx deVvapitanU deVvasutanU oMdeV Ada kAraNa (BagavaMtanU yeVsukirxsatxnU oMdeV AdadadxriMda). 
\num{8} (yAvudeV viSayada) tiruLu; sAra; sArAMsha; tAtapxyaR: \eng{I can give you the substance of his remarks} Atana TiVkeya sArAMshavanunx nAnu ninage heVLabalelx. 
\num{9} aishavxyaR; saMpatutx; AsitxpAsitx: \eng{a woman of substance} aishavxyaRvaMte; AsitxvaMte. \eng{waste one's substance} AsitxpAsitxyanenxlAlx (duMdugArikeyiMda) poVlu mADu, kaLe. \eng{a man of substance} shirxVmaMta; gaTiTx kuLa. 
\numi{10} (savxBAvada yA shiVlada) 
\banum
\alnum{a} gAMBiVyaR; Ganate. 
\alnum{b} sethxYyaR; sithxrate: \eng{there is no substance in him} avanalilx Ganate (yA sethx YyaR) ilalx. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\eng{in substance} tAtapxyaRdalilx; sArAMshadalilx: \eng{I agree with you in substance} sArAMshadalilx ninanx mAtanunx nAnu opupxtetxVne.

\bentry
\word[sun(1)]{sun} 
\pron{sanf}
\gl{\nA}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} sUyaR; ravi: 
\banum
\alnum{a} BUmi matutx itara garxhagaLu sututx hAkutitxruva tAre; hotutx: \eng{the sun rises} sUyaRnu huTuTxtAtxne, mUDutAtxne, udayisutAtxne, hotutx huTuTxtatxde. \eng{the sun sets} sUyaRnu muLugu tAtxne, asatxmisutAtxne; hotutx muLugutatxde. 
\alnum{b} vishavxdalilxna (garxhagaLiruva yA ilalxda) aMtha yAvudeV tAre. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} (sUyaRna) beLaku; bisilu; shAKa: \eng{let in the sun} sUyaRna beLakanunx oLakekx baragoDu. \eng{keep out the sun} bisilanunx oLakekx baradaMte taDe. 
\num{3} (\kAparx) dina yA vaSaR. 
\num{4} (\kAparx) sUyaR; veYBava, parxBe, teVjasusx, \mo vugaLa AkaraveMdu BAvisalAda vayxkitx yA vasutx. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{against the sun} = \hyperref{kandict_a.pdf}{A}{anticlockwise(1)}{$^1$anti-clockwise}. 
\num{2} \eng{a place in the sun} anukUla saninxveVsha yA sithxti. 
\num{3} \eng{beneath} (\engit{or} \eng{under) the sun} parxpaMcadalilx elAlxdarU; loVkadalelxlAlxdarU. 
\hyperdef{S}{sun(1) pagu(4)}{} 
\numi{4} \eng{catch the sun} 
\banum
\alnum{a} bisilu biVLuva sathxLadalilxru. 
\alnum{b} bisilalilx bADu, kaMdu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} \eng{hail} (\engit{or} \eng{adore) the rising sun} hosa yA baraliruva adhikAriyanunx hogaLu, olisiko, avana anugarxha koVru. 
\num{6} \eng{in the sun} bisilinalilx; bisilu biVLuvaMte. 
\num{7} \eng{let not the sun go down upon your wrath} ninanx koVpa oMdu dinada maTiTxgirali; ninanx korxVdhavu saMjeyoLagAgi shAMtavAgali, aDagali. 
\num{8} \eng{make} \hyperref{kandict_h.pdf}{H}{hay(1) nuga(2)}{$^1$hay} \eng{while the sun shines.} 
\num{9} \eng{on which the sun never sets} (cakArxdhipatayx \mo vugaLa \vi) sUyaR muLugada; vishavxvAyxpiyAda. 
\num{10} \eng{rise with the sun} sUyoRVdayakekx ELu; hotitxge muMce ELu. 
\num{11} \eng{see the sun} badukiru; jiVvaMtavAgiru: \eng{you'll never see the sun again} niVnu matetx sUyaRnanunx kANuvudilalx; niVnu inunx muMde badukalAre. 
\num{12} \eng{sun and planet} swravUyxhada, sUyaR matutx garxhagaLa vayxvasethxya -- geVru, giyaru; madhayxdalilx halulxgaLiruva akaSxdaMDada sutatxlU oMdoV halavoV cikakx cakarxgaLidudx, akaSxdaMDavu tananx akaSxda meVlU, uLida cakarxgaLu adara sutatxlU tirugutAtx cAlaneyanunx odagisuva EpARDu, vayxvasethx. 
\num{13} \eng{sun in splendour} (\vaMlAM) kiraNagaLuLaLx, mAnava muKaviruva sUyaR. 
\num{14} \eng{sun is set} avana, adara, \mo vugaLa -- ELigeya, aBivaqdidhxya, ucACx rxyada, utakxSaRda, kAla AgihoVyitu; mugidu hoVyitu. 
\hyperdef{S}{sun(1) pagu(15)}{} 
\num{15} \eng{take [or (\ashi) shoot] the sun} (\nw) akASxMshavanunx gotutxmADuvudakAkxgi sUyaRna koVnoVnanxtiyanunx kaMDuhiDi. 
\num{16} \eng{with the sun} = \hyperref{kandict_c.pdf}{C}{clockwise(1)}{$^1$clockwise}. 
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\num{2} (parxshAnxthaRka vAkayxdalilx) (vataRmAna kaqdaMtadalilx yA vidhayxthaRdalilx) -re; saMdaBaRdalilx; pakaSxdalilx; pakaSxkekx; oMdu veVLe; masala: \eng{supposing white were black you would be right} biLupu kapepxV Agidadx pakaSxkekx niVnu mADutitxruvudu yA ADutitxruvudu sariyAgutitxtutx. \eng{suppose your father saw you, what would he say?} ninanx taMde oMdu veVLe ninanxnunx noVDididxdadxre, noVDidaru eMdiTuTxkoLoLxVNa, Aga Enu heVLutitxdadxru? 
\num{3} (vidhayxthaR \parx) sUcaneya yA parxsAtxpada okakxNeyAgi: \eng{suppose we went for a walk} masala nAvu sutAtxDikoMDu baralu hoVgoVNa. \eng{suppose we try another time} beVromemx yatinxsoVNa aMtiVni.
